characters: A SAFETY PIN JIGGLING IN A DOOR LOCK. 38
ON HENRY, SINGING, OUT OF TUNE...
THE 28-YEAR-OLD HENRY WE JUST SAW WALKING AWAY FROM HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A camera P.O.V. on the hood of a moving car, pushing thro a slushy downpour of hard, sleety snow. We are on a small shopping street, festooned with Christmas decorations cir 1970; colored strings of lights in big teardrop bulbs, mo fashions in store windows. WOMAN’S VOICE “Und hat ein Bliimlein bracht... A BOY'S VOICE joins in, trying to reach her high notes, cheerfully out of tune. BOY’S VOICE “Mitten im kalten Winter...” We hear the boy laugh, the woman too...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HENRY DETAMBLE, 6 years old, sits in the back seat. His mother, ANNETTE, 32, drives.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: I can’t sing. HENRY’S P.O.V. His mother’s eyes look back at him in the rearview mirror, framed there, kind and beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: ANNETTE
dialogues.text: That was fine, honey.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: I can’t sing like you.

dialogues.speaker: ANNETTE
dialogues.text: Of course not. You’re supposed to sing like you.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07.13.07

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON ANNETTE, as BEHIND THEM, HEADLIGHTS blare into t rear window, a car tailgating.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: I love your voice.

dialogues.speaker: ANNETTE
dialogues.text: I love yours more. Just listening to you speak. She turns on her blinker, switching lanes, getting ready make a right, as the other car BLARES by, horn honking, kicking slush and mud up onto her windshield.

dialogues.speaker: ANNETTE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How about Jingle Bells? That you can sing. They start singing. The light turns green. EXT. RED BRICK BUILDING SHOPPING STREET -— SAME 3 We see ANNETTE’S CAR, driving off. An oversized plastic S waves automatically at us from the cover of a doorway. INT. CAR — SAME 4 ON HENRY, singing Jingle Bells with his mother, as she dr up the onramp and onto the turnpike, the interstate sign visible for a moment in her headlights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The little sedan drives on the slick highway, the asphalt totally white with snow. We can still hear them sing. A h DE-ICER blasts past them on the other side of a small dividing rail. INT. CAR — SAME 6 Annette and Henry sing “Jingle Bells,” picking up the tem as the car speeds along. Mom and son exchange a warm smil as something strange and off-kilter appears...LIGHTS, in front of them...A BUS coming at them head-on. ON ANNETTE, her eyes widening as she brakes. Henry’s fore slams into the hard edge of the front seat.  10 The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07.13.07 3

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bus is careening across the dividing rail. The two vehicles slide toward each other with deadly grace. The b HITS the little sedan, sending it spinning in circles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON HENRY as he sees out the side window a second ONCOMING VEHICLE, behind them in their part of the highway, as the spin.

dialogues.speaker: MOMMY
dialogues.text: HIS HANDS COME UP to touch the gash on his forehead...and then, we see his HANDS are becoming strangely TRANSPARENT Henry’s eyes widen. ON ANNETTE, looking back to him... Henry meets her eyes -- his whole body seems to be fading away...

dialogues.speaker: ANNETTE
dialogues.text: Henry! ON ANNETTE, confused as the lights become totally blindin HER P.O.V. But Henry is gone. Only his clothes lie crumpl on the seat.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. APARTMENT —- SUNNY DAY 9 ON LITTLE HENRY’S HAND...we see him, naked now, still loo at the hand, just as he had been in the car. The gash on forehead is bleeding. He looks up. HIS P.O.V. In front of him, at some distance, his mother sitting on the couch. She is reading to a little boy, HIMSELF, tucked beside her. A man is sitting with them; RICHARD, his father. ON BLEEDING HENRY, confused, his body starts to tremble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON HENRY...he stands, in the exact same posture, at side of the turnpike.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 10 The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07.13.07 4

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: HIS P.O.V. His mother’s sedan and the second car come together in a violent, deafening impact and burst into flames. Henry lurches forward, screaming for his mother, but a ha reaches out, grabs him, and yanks him back. He turns. HIS P.O.V. A MAN is standing over him. He is wearing a da overcoat, dark pants that seem too big, sloppy work boots untied. He has a blanket in his hands, which he drapes ov Henry and then pulls him close.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Let me go. Mommy. Mommy!!!

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: There’s nothing you can do, Henry.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Let me go! The man gets on his knees in the snow. Takes Henry by the shoulders, gently.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: I know what just happened to you. You were in the car with Mommy, and it was spinning, and then all of a sudden you were back at home, last summer, watching yourself. Watching Mommy and Daddy read to you.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: How do you...?

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: You traveled back in time, Henry. Just like I did to come here and see you. Feel that cut on your forehead? The man pulls back his own long hair and reveals a scar i the exact same place. Henry feels a chill right to his bo

dialogues.speaker: MAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I am you, Henry. We’re the same person. I know you don’t understand but you will. Someday. The man is HENRY DETAMBLE at age 28.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 10 11 12 The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07.13.07 5

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Henry6 looks over at the accident site. Starts to cry. Henry28 sees this.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY28
dialogues.text: Listen to me. I have to leave now. But I’1l be back. Lots of times. Everything's going to be alright, Henry. He kisses Henry6 on the top of his head and begins to wal away, aS cars are braking and GOOD SAMARITANS converge on scene. Henry6 hears yelling and turns to see people rushi toward him. When he turns back: HENRY 28 IS GONE...only his clothes and boots are there, footprints ending abruptly in the snow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A similarly vacated pile of clothes is on the stone floor a dimly-lit, temperature-controlled basement room. We PAN away from it to reveal we are in a chamber full of well- stacked BOOKSHELVES, and then...a groan causes the camera PAN BACK...

dialogues.speaker: THE 28-YEAR-OLD HENRY WE JUST SAW WALKING AWAY FROM HENRY
dialogues.text: NOW STANDING THERE, naked, next to the clothes. He shivers; sore, cold. Haunted by where he has just been Seeing himself as a boy, on that night, has shaken him. H runs his hands through his hair. Henry starts to dress himself. Finds a large book on the floor, which he picks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The reading rooms at the library are the welcoming hub of old stone building; a cathedral of knowledge. Serious researchers work at tables stacked high with books. Henry appears from the back. He approaches the counter an presents the book to a RESEARCHER, a man in his forties.

dialogues.speaker: RESEARCHER
dialogues.text: That took you long enough.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: You have no idea. This should be what you’re looking for. If not, we'll have to pick it up after the holidays.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 12 13 The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07.13.07 6

dialogues.speaker: RESEARCHER
dialogues.text: Right. Christmas Eve. Got some nice plans?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Yeah, big plans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry is knocking back a shot of whiskey. Sets it down on bar.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Another. The BARTENDER fills the shot glass again.

dialogues.speaker: BARTENDER
dialogues.text: If you’re going to come here every Christmas, you at least oughta bring me a present. Henry looks at him. Takes a pencil out of his breast pock and lays it on the bar. The Bartender picks it up, examines it.

dialogues.speaker: BARTENDER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (drily) Thanks. He puts it in his pocket, as INGRID CARMICHAEL, 26, a hig strung, edgy blonde, comes into the bar, dragging a four Christmas tree behind her. She walks over to Henry. She’s been drinking too.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Hey, baby. Look, I got a tree! They were practically giving ‘em away.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Ingrid, I told you...

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Blah blah, you want to be alone on Christmas, well, I don’t, okay? I mean, are we dating, or not?  14 15 The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07.13.07 7

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ingrid comes out of the bathroom in a slinky silk robe. L at Henry sitting on the couch next to the sad, undecorate tree with its string of unlit lights.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Henry. You’re supposed to do the lights! The guy does the lights.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Can we...do this without lights?

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: You're such a creep. She walks over to the tree and plugs in the lights. They brighten until they begin to flash. We can see they are bothering him...

dialogues.speaker: INGRID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now. Isn’t this nice? Henry...? He stands, woozy, a pasty look on his face. Ingrid knows look.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: I have to go.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Not again...

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: (starting to leave) -.-.-I’m sorry...

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: I swear to god, if you leave this time, that’s it! Don’t ever bother coming back! We hear the door SLAM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry is trembling, trying to make it down the stairs. An OVERHEAD SHOT, as he passes into frame around each cor of the landings until, finally...he FAILS TO APPEAR, and instead his empty shoes fall down the stairs. They come t rest on the landing.  16 17 18 19 The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07.13.07 8

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON AN EXIT SIGN, the universal symbol of the lit-up running man. The door opens and Henry steps out of the stairwell and into a corridor lined with stripped hospita beds: the Housekeeping Services area located in the Hospital’s bowels. He ducks into the deserted LINEN’S ROOM. A MERRY CHRISTMA banner and a garland of tinsel hangs over the folding station. Henry spots a paper pad. HIS P.O.V. AN INVENTORY FORM FOR THE ST. JOSEPH’S HOSPITA dated the 24th OF DECEMBER 1970. Henry’s face clouds. ANGLE CORRIDOR, as a FEMALE CANDY STRIPER arrives with another bed. She strips the mattress and the pillow and i about to carry the laundry into the linen’s room when Hen emerges, now dressed as a candy striper himself. She bare acknowledges him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry passes Service Workers spraying rows of bed frames chemical disinfectant. He slows in front of a fire exit diagram, orients himself and moves on. He takes a shortcu only to find himself in:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry stops dead in his tracks as he comes upon a COVERED BODY lying on a slab. It is the only body in the morgue. Henry stares at the wrapped form, clearly distressed, as making the connection. He seems about to touch the body b instead glances at a wall mounted clock. He realizes that he’s running late and pulls himself away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry appears out of an elevator. It is busy and surreall bright inside against the snowy black outside the large windows. He is looking for someone. We see his eyes land; has found what he seeks: A MAN standing at the main desk. We saw him before, by th couch with Henry. He is RICHARD DETAMBLE, 30, Henry’s fat

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: No, I know they’re here. I got a call. They said my wife and son... (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07.13.07

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: they were in an accident. DeTamble, Annette and Henry DeTamble, he’s only six..

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: (on a house telephone) I’m checking, sir... Henry is suddenly standing beside his father.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Excuse me, Mr. DeTamble? Richard stares at the adult Henry. He has no idea who he

dialogues.speaker: HENRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Your son is fine. They just moved him to room 204.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: He’s alright? Henry leads him toward the elevator and pushes the up but

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: He’s been calling for you. He needs you. The elevator doors open and Henry ushers Richard inside. Henry does not follow. Richard looks out at him.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: What about my wife? Why isn’t she with him? Henry doesn’t answer. The doors start to close, wiping He from view...

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Wait! He stops the doors, leans out. HIS P.O.V. The dressing gown lies on the floor. A MALE CA STRIPER wheeling a big laundry cart scoops it up and puts in his bin as he passes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry, dressed, but barefoot, carrying his shoes, trudges back up the steps. Knocks on Ingrid’s door.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 20 21 22 The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07.13.07 1

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Ingrid? It’s Henry...open the door. She whips open the door, scowling at him.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Where did you go?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: «+.to get some air.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Tell me the goddamn truth. For once. He stares at her, so weary.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: I’m a time traveler. (beat) I travel through time. I can’t control it, it just happens... She slams the door in his face. Henry looks down, all alo in the dark, silent hallway.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Merry Christmas, Henry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HENRY is jogging along Lakeshore Drive. The sun is shinin breeze ruffling the trees. It is a beautiful day. Joggers everywhere. Henry seems to run faster and stronger than a of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry comes into the big wide reading room. He crosses by GIRL at one of the tables. She doesn’t look up. Henry goes to the check-out desk and lays down his books, looking through them, his back to the girl. They both rem in the frame, not seeing one another and then... A FEMALE STAFFER passes the girl, who looks up.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: Excuse me.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07.13.07

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The staffer turns, Henry doesn’t.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m looking for the Kelmscott Press Chaucer, actually I’m interested in the papermaking at Kelmscott...

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN STAFFER
dialogues.text: Perhaps Mr. DeTamble can help you with that. He’s our special collections librarian. The staffer gestures toward Henry, who raises his head, starts to turn... ON THE GIRL, smiling...

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: Excuse me, I’m looking for... And then she stops. Her face stunned. Henry stares at her Sees the queer look on her face.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Can I help you with something? And now she smiles...her heart is caught in her throat.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: Henry?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Yes... And just as suddenly, tears spring to her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: Henry. It’s you. And now she laughs, pushing back the tears.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I can’t believe it. I’m sorry, you said this would happen and you told me to be normal when it did and I’m really not...being very normal... The woman staffer shoots Henry a cross look. He has a reputation with the ladies. But this girl seems young... Henry goes to the girl and pulls her aside.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07.13.07

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, but I really...I don’t know you.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: My name is Clare, Clare Abshire. I know you don’t know me. You’re not supposed to. But we need to talk. We really do. She can see his discomfort. She brings her voice down.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: Look, I know how odd this must be for you, it’s odd for me too. But...would you? Have dinner with me? Let me try to explain?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Um...

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: Please. Listen to me. You want to do this. I know you do. We’ve been planning this dinner for four years.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: We have?

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: Yes. We’ll go to the Beau Thai. It’s your favorite restaurant.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: (reluctant) How do you know that? She looks at him. Takes in his rumpled clothes, long, unk hair, his unshaven, haunted, slightly paranoid look.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: You look like you've been having a rough time. He’s taken aback by her gentle recognition.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Everything’s gonna be okay, Henry. Beat. He searches her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 22 23 24 The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07.13.07 1

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: So is it yes? To dinner? We hold on Henry. He can’t help but laugh. This girl is beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: ...okay.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: (big smile) Wow! Okay. Seven o’clock. Beau Thai. This is going to be great! Trust me. This is the best day of your entire life. She kisses him tenderly but fully on the mouth and then t and nearly skips out of the library. ON HENRY...an amazed expression on his face, and then...T he couldn’t begin to explain begin welling in his eyes as stands there motionless.

dialogues.speaker: LIBRARIAN
dialogues.text: Who was that? Why are you crying?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: I don’t know. INT. HENRY’S APARTMENT - EVENING 23 THE CAMERA TRACKS through Henry’s messy apartment - cloth dirty cups, books strewn about - a bouquet of roses in cellophane sitting on the table, until it discovers Henry standing in front of a mirror in his bathroom. He’s nervo making an effort. He checks his teeth in the mirror, then opens the cabinet, removes a deodorant stick and opens hi shirt, doing a quick run across his pits. He reaches towa the cabinet to put it back, the camera TRACKING with his We see his HAND IS SHAKING.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Shit. Not now. The cabinet door swings closed. There is no one in the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the same Henry we just saw, only now he is naked racing down a street. Two POLICEMEN, billy clubs in their hands, race after him. The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07.13.07

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CLOCK on the wall shows that it is 7:39 p.m. We PAN DOWN OFF IT to reveal CLARE sitting at a booth. Sh looks beautiful in a dress, her hair down, curled. A wait comes up to her:

dialogues.speaker: WAITER
dialogues.text: Would you like to order a drink while you’re waiting?

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: Just some wine, please. The waiter goes off. She looks down, fiddling with someth CLOSE ON THE OBJECT IN HER HAND, a small girl's diary, bl leather, with a little brass locking flap. Then... She looks up. HENRY IS THERE, his face covered in perspiration, and bruised. He is breathless as he sees he He awkwardly hands her the bouquet of flowers.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: I’m really sorry, I was...uh... detained.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: It’s okay. I ordered us some Pad Thai. They’re keeping it warm. She notices his bruises.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You alright?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: It’s...it’s okay.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: Come, sit down. He sits. They stare at each other a moment. There’s a fee of first date excitement here, though neither really know how to play it. Clare admires the flowers.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: These are beautiful. You’ve never given me flowers before.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 25 The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07.13.07 1

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: I’ve never given you anything before. She smiles. He doesn’t quite know how to read it. The wai brings her wine. They wait for him to leave.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Listen, you do understand why it is that I don’t know you?

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: Of course. For you, none of this has happened yet, but for me...I've known you since I was six. Since you appeared in the meadow behind my parents’ house, in Michigan, where I used to play. While she’s talking, Henry has taken her glass of wine an downed a big draught. He pushes it back. She frowns.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You’re not supposed to drink.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Yeah, why’s that?

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: You told me Dr. Kendrick said you should stop drinking, that it sets off the...fit, the travel. Henry stares at her for a beat.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: This is...this is too crazy.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: I’m sorry. I’m doing this all wrong. You told me to be easy on you and I’m doing it all wrong. She grabs a paper napkin and takes a pen out of her purse

dialogues.speaker: CLARE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You did this for me once. She draws two straight lines. Labels one Henry and one Cl

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 25 The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07.13.07 1

dialogues.speaker: CLARE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This line is my life, and this line is your life. She makes a little slash near the middle of his line.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This point is you, now, tonight. Her finger follows past the point of now, down Henry’s line...

dialogues.speaker: CLARE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And later on down the line of your life, in the future, you cross back... She draws a connecting line that slants backward, to the early part of her line...

dialogues.speaker: CLARE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And I meet you here, at the beginning of my line.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: When you were six. In the meadow.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: And many more times. After a while, I couldn't wait for you to come back.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Which I gather I did, or will do, fairly often. She nods.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: The last time I saw you I was eighteen. (beat) It seems you go back to the same places a lot. At least that’s what you told me.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: It’s like gravity. Big events pull you in.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: So I was a big event?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07.13.07

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: So it would seem. Henry squirms a little in his seat. He rubs one of his bruises unconsciously. It hurts.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Clare?

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Could we back up? Could we pretend for a moment that this is a normal first date between two normal people?

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: Sure. Of course. I’m so sorry Henry. I keep forgetting. It’s just, you know, it’s like you're my best friend. I’ve...I’ve been in love with you...all my life. On Henry, taking this in. Clare can see how hard it is fo him. She dips a napkin in a glass of ice water. She reach over and touches his bruises with the napkin. He cannot believe she is doing this. It is intimate, impossibly familiar, but he doesn’t stop her. 26 INT. HENRY’S APARTMENT - NIGHT 26 Sounds of voices, as locks unclick, a door opening... A P.O.V. through a cloth, images of shadow, sifted throug thin fabric, a little light coming through...

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: Is this really necessary?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Count to one thousand while I clean up. On Clare, BLINDFOLDED, as she hears strange sounds, Henry doing things, moving stuff.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: One, two, four hundred and ten thousand, eight hundred and fifty- (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 26 The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07.13.07 1

dialogues.speaker: CLARE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: two thousand, nine hundred and sixty-seven thousand, a million. She takes off the blindfold... HER P.O.V. Henry has put a cloth over a lamp to mute the light. It makes the apartment seem romantic, a reader’s garret, piled with books, a couch covered with an Indian print blanket. He stands there, smiling sort of dumbly at this beautiful girl, standing in his flat, clearly smitten with it, with him.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: If you want a drink...

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: I don’t want a drink. She steps up to him, looks into his eyes, and starts unbuttoning his shirt. He just stares at her. It’s amazin him that she’s so sure, that they don’t have to play any games. He could fall in love with this girl. She parts the fabric of his shirt and runs her hands alon his chest, his belly.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: God. You're so...young... She kisses his neck, his mouth; a passionate, familiar ki It blows him away, her confidence, the way their mouths f He pulls her in to him, roughly now, he wants her, his ha running up to her breasts. He is young and eager, discove a new body. She pushes him back. Makes him sit on the cou Climbs on top of him, straddling him, but he flips her on her back and in so doing, KICKS HER PURSE over...everythi dumps onto the floor. It’s more than a little awkward.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Sorry... He quickly picks up the stuff...he has the DIARY. She gra it away from him, shoves the purse away.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What was that?

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: My diary. My Henry book. I used to write about you, every time you (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 26 27 The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07.13.07 1

dialogues.speaker: CLARE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: came to visit, because it was a secret. I couldn’t tell anyone...

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Can I see it?

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: The silly scribblings of a hopelessly romantic girl? Never... She starts over, climbing back on top of him, wrapping he legs around him. This time he lets her lead. She kisses h They are getting more passionate, limbs intertwining... S kisses his neck, his chest, his belly.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: .-.-Clare...tell me something... about the meadow. Tell me how we met.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: It’ll spoil it for you. It won't happen for you for several years.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Spoil me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see flashes of hair, of little feet in Mary Janes and socks, we HEAR humming, as young CLARE, eight-years-old, pushes through the sun-dappled woods and into... AN OPEN, GRASSY MEADOW. She is in her school uniform, a g jumper and white blouse. She is carrying a tattered Marsh Field’s shopping bag and a RED BLANKET, which she lays ou a log that lies like a perfect bench in the clearing. She continues humming...the theme to “The Dick Van Dyke Show. Suddenly, from behind some bushes, she sees something mov

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: Who’s there? No answer. She gets up to explore. Suddenly a voice comes from very close to her, in the foliage...

dialogues.speaker: HENRY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Greetings, Earthling.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: Mark, you idiot.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 27 The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07.13.07 2

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She takes off her shoe and throws it into the bushes. She sees the bushes shake, hears a grunt and an “Ow.”

dialogues.speaker: HENRY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Clare, I’m not going to hurt you, please don’t throw anything at me. Little girl Clare frowns, hands on her hips. To hide her fear, she fires out bossy questions.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: Who are you? How do you know my name? Why can’t you come out?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I don’t...have any clothes on. Clare stares into the bushes... HER P.O.V. She can now see Henry, his face, his eyes, and nothing else.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Can you just...hand me that blanket? And I’1l come out.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: Maybe I should call my mom.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Don’t call your Mom. Please. Just give me the towel and I’1l leave. She hesitates. Then goes back to the log, picks up the blanket, comes back to the bushes and holds it out... We see Henry’s hand emerge from the bushes, grabbing the blanket, then Henry appears with it wrapped around his wa Clare sort of laughs.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: Why don’t you have any clothes?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Because I’m a time traveler. I come from the future and when I do, I don’t get to bring my clothes.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: There’s no such thing as time travelers.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Well, there is. That’s how I know your name. You and I are friends, in the future, when you’re a lady. Long beat.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: Am I pretty?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Yes. She smiles slightly to herself.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: Prove you’re from the future.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Well, your name is Clare Abshire, born May 24, 1971. Your parents are Phillip and Lucille Abshire, and you live with them and your brother Mark and your sister Alicia ina big house on the other side of the woods.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: So. You know things. That doesn’t mean you’re from the future.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: If you hang around long enough, you'll see me disappear. And I’11l be back again. Lots of times. In fact I'll be back next Tuesday, at 4:00. It would be great if when you come then you could bring me some clothing, something your dad won’t miss. A voice calls out from the distance.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Clare! Where are you? She jumps up. Henry looks at her imploringly.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: It’s a secret, okay? I gotta go. (he reaches out to shake (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 27 28 29 30 The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07.13.07 2

dialogues.speaker: HENRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: her hand) It was nice to meet you. She shakes his hand with her small one, and as she does, sees his hand start to become TRANSPARENT...she LOOKS UP. Henry is gone. Only the red blanket lies in the grass. We hold on her stunned little face. She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. HENRY’S APARTMENT — DAWN 28 Clare and Henry asleep in his bed. Clare is waking up. Sh looks over at him. Smiles. Can’t believe she’s with him. sits up, trying to be quiet. HER P.O.V. His bedroom is a shambles. Clothes are piled u the floor. The paint is peeling in the room. Pretty ugly. She gets out of bed, pulling on one of his shirts, which bit smelly, but she does it anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pads out into the room. Last night’s couch is reveale be horrible -- tattered, stuffing coming out, stained wit water-rings and telltale cigarette burns. Clare looks around. The gray morning light coming in the windows illuminates his apartment. Beer cans and dirty di are dotted around. It is the apartment of a callow young Not romantic at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clare comes in. Opens the shower curtain. HER P.O.V. In the bath tub is a lot of books and papers a dirty clothes. Some styrofoam take-out cartons with half- eaten food. He obviously dumped them in here the night be in an attempt to clean up. Clare opens the medicine chest and peers inside. Lying on one shelf are tampons, a diaphragm case, lipstick, and a of spermicide. ON HER FACE, fascinated and surprised. She never thought he might be with someone. She hears Henry:

dialogues.speaker: HENRY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I told you I was... (appearing in the doorway) ..-mMessy.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07.13.07

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She turns to him. She’s holding the woman’s lipstick.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: You have a girlfriend?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Yes, I mean, no, I mean, it was almost over anyway.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: (deflated) I came bulldozing in here. It never occurred to me that you might be... with someone.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: ..+-you’re disappointed. Clare runs both hands down the flank of Henry’s body.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: It feels so odd. I never knew you at this age. I’ve only known you as this mature, worldly person. You knew...exactly how to talk to me. You were kind of my perfect guy.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: My God. I’m competing with myself.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: No, no, it’s hard to explain...

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: The me you know doesn’t exist yet. Stick with me and sooner or later he’s bound to appear. That’s the best I can do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A PHOTOGRAPH...large, printed on an unusual surface. It i life-sized picture of a man, standing in a meadow, but hi features are obscured by the flecks in the paper; in fact his entire body seem to be dissolving away. Only his clot with their dark colors, are in sharp focus. We pull back, as a JANITOR crosses in front of the pictur mopping the floor.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 31 The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07.13.07 2

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Stencilled on the window of the lobby of a campus buildin are the words “Graduate Student Exhibit.” HENRY’S REFLECT moves into frame, as he looks in the window. Henry goes inside, seeking something, and then...HE STOPS His face registers part shock, part total recognition. HIS P.O.V. OF THE PHOTOGRAPH. He sees a nameplate above it. CLARE ABSHIRE. REVERSE ANGLE...on Henry's back, as he looks at the photo his own body silhouetted against the figure in the image, their shapes matching for a brief moment as he steps back and we HEAR, off screen.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: The show’s not open yet. He turns. Clare is there. Henry stands next to the photog and from Clare’s POV it looks like she’s facing two of hi

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: I thought I’d try early for a change.

dialogues.speaker: YCLARE
dialogues.text: How did you find it, I didn’t tell you...

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: I’m a research librarian. If I want to find out about someone, I find out. She smiles, pleased. A little embarrassed. They look at t photograph, standing side by side, in silence for a momen

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: Well, what do you think?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: It’s great, it’s...terrifying.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: Terrifying?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: My life depends on how well I can keep a secret. Seeing it out there like that...feels like I just went public.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07.13.07

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: God, I never even thought of that...

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Don’t worry. I mean, who’s gonna connect the dots, right? It just caught me off-guard. He smiles at her, bringing levity to the moment.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: I know what it’s like to watch you go. But what’s it like...to be the one that’s going?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Sometimes it feels like you’ve stood up too quickly, your hands and feet are tingling and then they aren’t there at all. Sometimes it feels like your attention has wandered for just an instant. Then, with a start you realize that you’re standing, naked, up to your ankles in ice water in a ditch. You wait a minute to see if you’1ll just snap right back. Then, after some swearing and shivering you start walking in any direction, which will eventually yield someplace that offers the option of stealing or explaining. Stealing can get you in trouble but explaining takes more time and involves lying, which might get in trouble anyways, so what the hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are walking together, mid-conversation.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: Are you ever afraid?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Absolutely. I’m afraid of finding myself in the middle of a highway, getting hit by a car. I’m afraid of getting stranded in time and not being able to come back.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 32 The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07.13.07 2

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He smiles 32

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: When I was little, I used to wish that you would get stuck. I imagined I’d move you into the basement and you could live with me all the time, and I’d sneak you food, like when you would come to the meadow.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: You bring me food in the meadow?

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: Peanut butter and anchovy sandwiches, pate and beets on Ritz crackers. I thought that’s the sort of thing an adult would like. at her.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: How did your parents never get wind of this?

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: My parents are very self-absorbed, ambitious people. They like to win, at everything, even if the opponent is their own children. I was much too...dreamy for them. After a while, they just ignored me. They arrive at her car. He stops, turns to her. She smiles and kisses

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: I can’t believe anyone could ignore you.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: You never did. You were wonderful.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: You mean the perfect me? . He touches her slender neck. Bends his head down her, ever so softly on the lips. It’s like a first kiss in many ways. They both feel it.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07.13.07 33 INT. CLARE’S APARTMENT —- ANOTHER NIGHT (SUMMER) 33 A small table set for four. Clare is introducing Henry to roommate, CHARISSE, and her roommate’s boyfriend, GOMEZ.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: This is Charisse, my roommate, my best friend, and our excellent cook for tonight, because I cannot cook.

dialogues.speaker: GOMEZ
dialogues.text: You should know that going in. Lovely girl. Can’t cook toast. Charisse, a pretty Filipino girl, shakes Henry’s hand.

dialogues.speaker: CHARISSE
dialogues.text: Please ignore Gomez. I just keep him around to lift heavy objects.

dialogues.speaker: GOMEZ
dialogues.text: And sex. Don’t forget sex. Henry shakes hands with Gomez, who is tall and blonde.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Gomez? I was expecting someone more Hispanic.

dialogues.speaker: GOMEZ
dialogues.text: Short for Golomonski, Polish.

dialogues.speaker: CHARISSE
dialogues.text: Wine, Henry?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: No, thanks. He catches Clare’s eyes, she’s smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charisse and Clare are washing the dishes, whispering...

dialogues.speaker: CHARISSE
dialogues.text: He’s so cute, you didn’t tell me how cute he was. Gomez comes in with more dishes.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 34 35 36 The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07.13.07 2

dialogues.speaker: GOMEZ
dialogues.text: He’s not that cute. And he doesn’t have a car. He says he’s not allowed to drive. Charisse throws a sponge at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry is walking down the hall. He looks into a room... HIS P.O.V. He sees Clare’s camera and bag on the bed, ano of her PHOTOS on the wall, this one of a little girl’s le in knee socks and Mary Janes, standing next to an empty p of man’s shoes. He looks behind him, then slips INTO HER ROOM. INT. CLARE’S BEDROOM - NIGHT 36 Henry is looking through her desk drawers. He does this quickly, a man on a mission. He finds what he wants: HER LITTLE BLUE DIARY. He sits down. Takes a piece of pap and a pen and starts flipping through it, quickly scribbl down a list of something, we don’t know what, until...A THROAT CLEARS, startling him. GOMEZ stands in the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: GOMEZ
dialogues.text: What are you doing? Henry quickly covers the diary with a large book.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: ...uh, I brought these books for Clare, on paper-making. I just wanted to...leave them for her. But Gomez can see the corner of the little blue notebook.

dialogues.speaker: GOMEZ
dialogues.text: She’s looking for you. Henry goes out, past Gomez. Charisse appears.

dialogues.speaker: CHARISSE
dialogues.text: I like him. Don’t you?

dialogues.speaker: GOMEZ
dialogues.text: Not sure yet.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 36 37 The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07.13.07 2

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Hold on Gomez’s doubting face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Noise from the concert venue pounds out the front door. T are people milling around, smoking, a happening place. Gomez steps out of the place and walks toward the back al We can HEAR a song by the Buzzcocks, “What Do I Get?”, blasting from inside the Vic, a famous Chicago music venu Gomez lights up a cigarette when he sees: A BRAWL in progress at the end of the alley, near the tra cans; someone is getting beat up.

dialogues.speaker: GOMEZ
dialogues.text: Hey. Hey! He runs down and tries to break up the fight... A BIG SUBURBAN GUY is having the crap beat out of him by skinny dude in pink short shorts and a small skintight pi shirt. Gomez grabs the pink dude and pulls him away...

dialogues.speaker: GOMEZ, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey, man, knock it off... He sees the pink dude’s angry face...IT IS HENRY, age 41.

dialogues.speaker: GOMEZ, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Henry!?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Gomez!

dialogues.speaker: GOMEZ
dialogues.text: What the hell? What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: This guy likes to beat up fags. The Suburban guy gets up and scrambles away. Gomez doesn’ even care, because he is staring at Henry. Something is v wrong here. Henry’s got short hair. With gray in it. He l kind of ravaged and different.

dialogues.speaker: GOMEZ
dialogues.text: What’s with your hair? And what the hell are you wearing?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 37 38 The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07.13.07 3

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: What’s the date today?

dialogues.speaker: GOMEZ
dialogues.text: I don’t know. September 12th.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: What year?

dialogues.speaker: GOMEZ
dialogues.text: What year? We just had dinner, couple of hours ago.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Right. Look, I gotta go. I gotta get some clothes.

dialogues.speaker: GOMEZ
dialogues.text: Yeah. Pink isn’t working for you.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Catch you later.

dialogues.speaker: GOMEZ
dialogues.text: No way. Not in your condition. I’m coming with you.

dialogues.speaker: GOMEZ
dialogues.text: What the hell are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Breaking and entering. The door opens. He hurries inside an Army Surplus store. Gomez, frightened, curious, follows.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don’t touch anything. Henry begins selecting clothes off the rack and trading t for his pink shirt and shorts.

dialogues.speaker: GOMEZ
dialogues.text: What the hell is going on here? Your hair is gray, man. You're a decade older than a week ago. Henry stares at him. Weary.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: You know what? I’m going to tell you, cause you and I are going to be friends for a long time, as it turns out, so you might as well know now.

dialogues.speaker: GOMEZ
dialogues.text: Know what?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: The reason I look older is because I am older. I’ve come back to this night from the future. I’m a time traveler. Gomez stares. And then laughs.

dialogues.speaker: GOMEZ
dialogues.text: Good. Good one.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Gomez, listen. I know how smart you are and I think you can get your head around this. I have...fits, like epileptic fits, sometimes they’re brought on by alcohol, or light, sometimes even snow on the TV, but mostly they come when I’m stressed, or upset, and I disappear, and I travel backward, or forward in time. I just came from the year 2005. What year is this?

dialogues.speaker: GOMEZ
dialogues.text: 1992. I don’t like this.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: When I travel, I get there, and I’m naked and I need something to wear, so I jumped this gay hooker, and I stole his clothes. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: GOMEZ
dialogues.text: Dude. If you’re gay, you should just tell Clare and let her meet a new guy. - 07.13.07 31. 38

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07.13.07

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Gomez, I’m telling you the truth. I get dislocated in time. I never know when it’s going to happen or where I’1ll end up. So in order to cope, I pick locks, shoplift, mug people, panhandle, break and enter, you name it, I’ve done it.

dialogues.speaker: GOMEZ
dialogues.text: There’s something wrong with you.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Yes. There is.

dialogues.speaker: GOMEZ
dialogues.text: (pissed) What’s it like? In 2005? Do Charisse and I get married?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Gomez...

dialogues.speaker: GOMEZ
dialogues.text: Do I get fat? Does she get fat?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: I’m not going to tell you about your life. Knowing stuff in advance, it makes you crazy. Look at me. It complicates things and you can’t change it anyway.

dialogues.speaker: GOMEZ
dialogues.text: You're full of shit, you know that? Henry is starting to look ill. His hand is starting to sh

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: You won’t think that in a minute.

dialogues.speaker: GOMEZ
dialogues.text: Oh yeah? Why's that?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: You'll see.

dialogues.speaker: GOMEZ
dialogues.text: Come on, asshole, you come from the future, give me some baseball scores, some stock tips...

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 38 39 The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07.13.07 3

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Okay, asshole, I‘'ll give you one word, “Internet”. Just remember that. Buy anything with a dot com at the end of it.

dialogues.speaker: GOMEZ
dialogues.text: Dot com? What the hell does that mean? (beat) Henry? Henry is no longer there. Gomez spins around and begins hyperventilating as he sees the pile of clothes on the ground. Gasping, he scrambles to find a pen.

dialogues.speaker: GOMEZ, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Dot com. Jesus. Dot com. He writes it on his arm. In the distance, a police siren.

dialogues.speaker: GOMEZ, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Shit. He races from the store. INT. CLARE’S APARTMENT —- MORNING 39 Clare answers the door. GOMEZ IS THERE.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: Gomez? Hey. Charisse is out.

dialogues.speaker: GOMEZ
dialogues.text: Is Henry here? Clare sees he means business. She opens the door and lets in.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: No. He’s at the library.

dialogues.speaker: GOMEZ
dialogues.text: Clare, I spent last night with him.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: You did?

dialogues.speaker: GOMEZ
dialogues.text: (nods ) First he beat up a guy in an alley. Then we burglarized the Army-Navy (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07.13.07

dialogues.speaker: GOMEZ, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: store. And then he told me about time traveling.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: (surprised) Did you believe him?

dialogues.speaker: GOMEZ
dialogues.text: Believe him? He looked ten years older and disappeared right in front of me!

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: I hate when he does that.

dialogues.speaker: GOMEZ
dialogues.text: You’re telling me you know about this?

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: Yes. I’ve known for a long time. Since I was a child. Gomez sits with a sigh.

dialogues.speaker: GOMEZ
dialogues.text: Don’t marry him, Clare.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: GOMEZ
dialogues.text: Don’t marry Henry.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: He hasn’t asked me yet.

dialogues.speaker: GOMEZ
dialogues.text: You know what I mean.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: Gomez, I love him.

dialogues.speaker: GOMEZ
dialogues.text: I caught him the other night, reading your diary.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: --What?

dialogues.speaker: GOMEZ
dialogues.text: This guy... You have to be careful. He’s a freak of nature...

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 39 40 The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07.13.07 3

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: He’s my husband. He always was and will be...

dialogues.speaker: GOMEZ
dialogues.text: That’s a silly romantic girl talking. You’re smarter than that.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: I know him. I know what he’1l be like in ten years. And I’‘1l like him even better then. He never tried to take advantage, he never even told me his last name, so I couldn’t try to find him. I had no way of knowing if I would ever see him again. But out of the blue...we meet. If that isn’t destiny, I don’t know what is.

dialogues.speaker: GOMEZ
dialogues.text: Clare, whatever’s happened in the past, you have a choice. You always do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door to the el train opens and Henry jumps on. He is and wearing a gym suit several sizes too big for him and looks a bit foolish. He stands there nervously and seems happy when the doors close. IN THE BG, as the train leaves, we see a man in underwear rushing toward the train yelling, shaking his fist. Henry grabs a seat and looks around. The advertisements a from 1967. Suddenly he freezes. HIS P.O.V. Across from him, just a few seats down is his mother. She is reading an opera score. He swallows. Watches her, and then:

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Excuse me, are you...Annette DeTamble?

dialogues.speaker: ANNETTE
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07.13.07

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: I love you...your work, your singing. You have a great voice.

dialogues.speaker: ANNETTE
dialogues.text: Thank you. I appreciate that. People don’t usually recognize me. Not on the subway anyway.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: My name’s Henry.

dialogues.speaker: ANNETTE
dialogues.text: How funny. I have a son named Henry. He’s just three. 40 Henry is moved to hear her talking about him. He is looki at her, intently, his mother, and he says...

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: I’m going to get married.

dialogues.speaker: ANNETTE
dialogues.text: Oh, really?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: I’ve...I’ve met this amazing girl. I don’t know why I told you that. Maybe I...wish you could sing at my wedding.

dialogues.speaker: ANNETTE
dialogues.text: Well...I don’t know...

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: No, no. I’m not asking...I’m just glad I...met you.

dialogues.speaker: ANNETTE
dialogues.text: I’m glad I met you too. I hope you have a wonderful wedding.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Thank you. That really...means so much to me. Henry’s hand starts to shake, time’s running out.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Your son must love you very much.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 40 4l 42 The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07.13.07 3

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She’s strangely touched by this. The train pulls into a station.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I have to run. Goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: ANNETTE
dialogues.text: (smiling) Goodbye...Henry. The doors open and he hurries onto the platform. HIS P.O.V. He looks at his mother, in the lit train. She waves to him, as the train pulls away. Shyly, almost awkwardly, he waves back. EXT - RICHARD’S BROWNSTONE - DAY 41 A small twenties-era red brick building surrounded by mod high rises. Henry bounds up the back stairs. He is the sa Henry we just left at the el train. INT. RICHARD’S BROWNSTONE - DAY 42 A house frozen in the seventies, mod furniture, cottage cheese ceilings with sparkles, shag carpet flattened and in places from years of wear. The drapes are closed, the Formica table littered with newspapers still bundled, unr Someone is knocking on the back door, and after no answer the door is unlocked and opened, and HENRY comes in. He looks around. Fingers the unread papers, stacks of unopened mail, wondering what’s going on, and then... HE HEARS THE TOILET FLUSH from the bowels of the house. RICHARD DETAMBLE shuffles out into the room. He is decade older than the first time we saw him at the hospital. He wasted version of himself.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Hi Dad.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: I was worried. I’ve called you four times.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07.13.07

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: I’ve been sick.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Yeah, I called the orchestra. When I didn’t hear from you, I thought Maybe you were on a tour...they told me you've been on sick leave since April.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: March. Richard raises his hands. They are shaking.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Makes it hard to play a violin.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Jesus. Have you seen a doctor?

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: What for? The nerves are shot and they aren’t coming back. Richard goes into the kitchen. Takes a big jug of Jim Bea down from the cupboard and pours himself a glass.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: That doesn’t help.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Sure it does. You want one?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: I don’t drink anymore. Richard looks at his son.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: That’s too bad. Drinking was one of the only things we did together.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Okay, Dad... Henry goes over and opens the curtains.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: First thing we need to do is get someone in here to clean, make you some meals. Do you even eat?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07.13.07

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: His father looks even worse in the light.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Would you like me to come around more? I could take you to the doctor, help you with your bills...

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: No to what? Everything or just some of it? Henry picks up the bills. Richard grabs them back, angril

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: I don’t need your help. Get your own life together before you start telling me how to live mine.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: I’m getting married, Dad. Long beat.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Who would marry you? Henry shakes his head, emits a rye cough of a laugh.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Does she know about...your...?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: She knows all about me. Her name is Clare Abshire. She’s an artist. (beat) I want to give her Mom’s wedding and engagement rings. Henry sees his father physically deflate.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I think Mom would have liked that.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: How do you know what your mother would have liked? You barely knew her.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 42 43 44 The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07.13.07 4

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: I knew her Dad. I still know her. I travel to her all the time. I’ve just seen her on the subway. Richard starts to walk away, but Henry won’t relent.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I see her singing at the Met, having coffee with Mara and Uncle Ish. Pushing me in the stroller. I see her with you, too. This thing I have isn’t always a curse. HIS P.O.V. Through a half-open door he sees his father ju standing there in his bedroom, staring. After a moment, Richard opens a drawer and take a small velvet box out of Richard comes back in.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: We were happy. Your mother and I.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: I know, dad. Richard puts the ring box in Henry’s hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Violent Femmes are playing. They start their song, “A It Up.” Henry and Clare are making their way to a balcony overlooking the stage.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: What’s wrong with you? You seem nervous. Are you nervous?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: I’m gonna get us something to drink. Hold on Clare as she watches him leave...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The band is now playing a new number. Clare glances at he watch. Henry’s still gone. After a moment she starts maki her way downstairs toward the bar... HER P.O.V. In the distance she sees Henry pressed up clos a sexy blonde (Ingrid, the woman with the Christmas tree)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 44 45 The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07.13.07 4

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: intimacy of their pose takes her breath away. As she gets closer she realizes they are fighting. Suddenly Henry bre away from her angrily, screaming something we can’t hear, storms away. Ingrid calls out.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: You son-of-a-bitch!!! Clare watches Ingrid push past the crowd toward the bathrooms. Henry sees Clare standing there and grabs her

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: I never made it to the bar.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: You want to leave?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: I want to dance. Come on.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: (disturbed) In a minute. She turns to go toward the bathroom. Henry watches her disappear into the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clare enters the ladies room. HER P.O.V. Ingrid is there, splashing water on her face, trying to recover from a bout of tears. She sees Clare in the mirror behind her.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: I’m sorry...I didn’t know he was dating someone else when we...

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: (erratic and bitter) Don’t try to be nice. Please. That’s what he does. “Oh, I’ma poor tortured soul.” You know what? Fuck him. You seem like a nice girl. And I’m telling you right now, you should run for the hills. That man will only bring you pain. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 45 46 The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07.13.07 4

dialogues.speaker: INGRID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: When you really need him, he will disappear. He’s shit and don’t say nobody ever told you. Ingrid goes out. Clare is really disturbed by this encoun She looks at herself in the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clare comes out of the bathroom and into the thumping, lo club. She searches for Henry but he is nowhere. Suddenly someone grabs her arm and spins her around. It is Henry, it is Henry with short hair, a decade older. He smiles. S stares at him for a moment and then dissolves into his ar

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: Henry, Henry. Oh God. I’ve missed you.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Missed me? You’ve been with me for months.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: I know, but not you, yet. I mean, you're different.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Hey, I didn’t know you existed. I was miserable dating Ingrid. I guess we were both pretty miserable. Clare, few people meet their soulmates at age six. I had to pass the time somehow. When I met you I was wrecked. I was pulling myself together. It’s a long way from the me you’re dealing with in 1993, to the me talking to you right now. You have to work with me. I can’t get there alone. (beat) Uh-oh. That poor idiot you came in with is looking for you. HER P.O.V. Long-haired Henry has a drink and is looking f her. She is suddenly filled with affection for him.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: He’s not an idiot.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07.13.07

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: (grins) See you in a few years. He kisses her and melds into the crowd. A moment later lo haired Henry arrives, all tension and concern.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey, you okay? I thought I lost you.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: No, I’m here.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Who was that guy you were talking to?

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: A friend. You'd like him. The Femmes start in on “Blister in the Sun...” Henry is jazzed.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Come on! I love this song! He sets the drink down on a ledge. He grabs her by the ha and leads her back into the club, his feet already hoppin She laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clare is sitting at the dining table, in her robe and nightgown, as Henry enters from the kitchen with an amazi cake, a candle stuck in the middle...he is singing "Happy Birthday" way off-key. He sets it down in front of her.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: Did you make this?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: (nods ) My mother’s recipe. Now, make a wish. She closes her eyes, blows out the candle.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What’d you wish?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07.13.07

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: I’m not telling.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: You’re such a tease.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: True. When I was sixteen, I was waiting for you late one night. It was about eleven o’clock, and there was a new moon. (taking a bite) Oh my god, this is amazing. Anyway, I was kind of annoyed with you, because you were resolutely treating me like - a child, or a pal, or whatever - and I was just crazy to touch you and...be touched by you, and then I got this idea that I would hide your clothes.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Oh, no.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: Yes. So I moved the clothes to a different spot. And you appeared, and I basically teased you until you couldn’t take it.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: And?

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: You jumped me and pinned me, and for about thirty seconds we both thought ‘This is it.’ But you got this look on your face, and you said ‘No,’ and you got up and walked away. You walked right through the Meadow into the trees and I didn’t see you again for three weeks.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: That’s a better man than I. She smiles at him, slyly.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: You do bad things.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07.13.07

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: I have done one or two of those.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: Like read my private diary. This shifts the dynamic between them.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Did Gomez tell you that?

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: Don’t be mad at him. He meant well.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: I didn’t read it. I just wanted to write down the dates. The dates I go to see you, and memorize them. So I can tell the little girl, in the meadow. I don’t want that girl to be hurt. If I’m so important to her, I want to be able to tell her when I’m coming, so she won’t wait, and hope, and waste away like I did, as a kid, you know, wishing...

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: Wishing what?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: That someone I love would come back. She looks at him, moved, unsure what to say in this momen

dialogues.speaker: HENRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Stay here. He goes into the bedroom and comes back holding a tiny jewelry box. Clare knows what’s coming. She’s not sure if she’s ready.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Clare. I love you. And it’s not just because you’re beautiful and brilliant and smart. It’s because...for the first time in my life, someone knows...who I really am. You’re all I want...will ever want.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 47 48 49 The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07.13.07 4

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He gets down on one knee. It’s all kind of goofy, and the are both aware of it, Henry smiling, Clare too, but her e filling with tears, as he opens the box.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Will you marry me? She stares at him. The mirth has faded away. She feels so much weight in this decision.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: oe.-NnoO. Henry looks at her, crushed. And then she suddenly grabs

dialogues.speaker: CLARE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I don’t mean that. I just...I had to try it, try saying it, just try to assert some sense of my own free will, but...my free will wants you. (her intensity is fierce) I don’t care what anyone says. I want you, Henry DeTamble.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: So does that mean...

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: Yes. It means yes, a hundred times yes. This is the best birthday wish come true ever! They embrace. Kiss. EXT. CLARE’S PARENTAL HOME IN MICHIGAN - DAY 48 A big wide shot of the whole compound, the stately old wh wood-frame house, the large, parklike property surroundin it, not a neighbor in sight. An S.U.V. has pulled into the driveway and Clare and her older brother, MARK, and younger sister, ALICIA, are pili out. Henry, 30, too. Clare is carrying her WEDDING DRESS, wrapped in plastic, like another body floating ahead of t group, all stuffed with paper. The four of them are laugh

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bustle of arrivals, Clare hoisting the dress through door, her mother, LUCILLE, a super coiffed 54, grabbing i

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 49 50 51 The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07.13.07 4

dialogues.speaker: LUCILLE
dialogues.text: Don’t drag it, oh my God, I told you to have it shipped...the florist has already called three times, and we have to go over the table assignments.

dialogues.speaker: ALICIA
dialogues.text: (taking the dress) Mother, give her a minute to breathe. We hear SHOTS being fired. In the garden, behind the hous we see Clare’s FATHER, PHILLIP, shooting clay pigeons, wh are being mechanically released. Lucille calls outside:

dialogues.speaker: LUCILLE
dialogues.text: Phillip, they’re here! ON HENRY, we can tell by his face that the wedding stress worries him. Clare pulls him toward her... INT. PHILIP’S STUDY - LATER 50 The walls are LINED with hunting trophies, heads of deer moose and bears. A gun cabinet. Philip, a taciturn man, i there. Henry shakes his hand, nods.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIP
dialogues.text: You ready for this? It’s a real circus.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: I’m ready sir. Clare’s father winks at him. Henry smiles, tries to be ga

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clare’s mother is in overdrive, handing out schedules.

dialogues.speaker: LUCILLE
dialogues.text: ...the rehearsal is at the church tomorrow at five, we have vans to bus people to the rehearsal dinner. Here’s the seating arrangement, you both have a look at that... ON CLARE AND HENRY, sitting on the couch, watching her. C sees that Henry is very uncomfortable. She takes his hand  52 53 54 55 The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07.13.07 4

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clare’s mother is still talking, standing now.

dialogues.speaker: LUCILLE
dialogues.text: ...the best man, what’s his name, Gomez? Do I have to call him that? He’1l function as our master of ceremonies, I hope he’s prepared, and the band has your playlist, which frankly, I think is too heavy on the contemporary artists...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clare’s mother still talking, now on the phone...

dialogues.speaker: LUCILLE
dialogues.text: ...we did not ask for vibernum, we asked for hydrangeas...then find the hydrangeas... HER P.O.V. THE COUCH -- now empty. Henry and Clare are go

dialogues.speaker: LUCILLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Clare...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clare pulls Henry through the woods, sunlight dappling through on them... They break through the trees and we see they are in: EXT. CLARE’S MEADOW - DAY 55 Henry looks around. It’s pretty; the sun shining, yellow. but Henry has no context.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: This is it?

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: This is the meadow! Don’t you love it? He pulls her to him, starts to kiss her neck.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Would it be sacrilegious to do it in the Meadow?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 55 56 The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07.13.07 4

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: We already did. When I was eighteen. I lost my virginity to you.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: I’1l look forward to that visit.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: Do you really have to stay in the hotel?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Honestly, I’m afraid if I’m around your mother another second, I’1l disappear. She can see that he is totally serious.

dialogues.speaker: ALICIA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Clare! Mom wants you! Clare kisses Henry goodbye and runs off. Henry stands in the meadow, alone. A breeze passes throug and blows some leaves around him. There’s a magical feeli here, some feeling of destiny that’s not entirely comfort

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see an array of barber tools laid out on a clean white cloth. AN OLD BARBER stares at Henry, waiting, and motion for him to get in the chair.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Cut it off.

dialogues.speaker: BARBER
dialogues.text: All of it?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: I’m getting married tomorrow and my wife, she likes the short hair. Henry smiles and the barber gets to work. Huge handsful o hair are cut away. Henry stares at himself in the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (acknowledging his image) That guy looks familiar, like someone I knew when I was a kid.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 56 57 58 59 The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07.13.07 5

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The barber smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry comes into the small-town hotel from his haircut, w he spots... HIS FATHER standing at the front desk.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Dad. (Richard turns) You came...

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: I wanted to be here for you. Henry is genuinely touched. They embrace.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I guess I’ll have to...meet her parents.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Yes. Her father is a Republican. And a hunter.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Oh dear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wide shot P.O.V. of an old stone Episcopal church through big old leaded glass window, we see toni guests arriving, pull back to reveal we are...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gomez is helping Henry into his tux. Henry is nervous.

dialogues.speaker: GOMEZ
dialogues.text: Valium? Is that a good idea?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: I don’t want anything to happen.

dialogues.speaker: GOMEZ
dialogues.text: Like what?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 59 60 The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07.13.07 5

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Standing in front of two hundred people and God and Clare’s parents and disappear to 1978!

dialogues.speaker: GOMEZ
dialogues.text: Isn’t there something you can do, some mind control, some act that helps you...stick around?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Two things. One is jogging.

dialogues.speaker: GOMEZ
dialogues.text: Okay, what’s the other?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Sex.

dialogues.speaker: GOMEZ
dialogues.text: .»+-go take the valium. Henry goes into the rest room to get a glass of water. No Gomez looks anxious enough for the two of them.

dialogues.speaker: GOMEZ, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You having problems? Henry, you okay? He walks into the rest room. Henry’s tux is laying crumpl on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: GOMEZ, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh, shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clare is standing there in her dress as her mother looks with a critical eye. She pushes at her hair.

dialogues.speaker: LUCILLE
dialogues.text: Oh God, this hair. It’s always been difficult.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: Mom, stop already. It’s fine.

dialogues.speaker: ALICIA
dialogues.text: You look amazing. When Henry sees you coming down the aisle, he is going to pass out on the spot.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 60 61 62 The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07.13.07 5

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Clare tenses.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: Alicia, can you go check on the boys?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gomez is in a frenzy, holding the tux, nearly hyperventilating. The church organ can be heard playing. voice calls out from the dressing room door.

dialogues.speaker: ALICIA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Nearly ready, guys?

dialogues.speaker: GOMEZ
dialogues.text: Ohmygod, ohmygod, ohmygod. (calling out, high pitched) Fine! We’re fine! Suddenly Gomez hears a knock at the window behind him and spins around. Henry is back, naked outside the building. it isn’t the Henry who just left. It is OLDER HENRY, unshaven, some gray in his hair. Gomez opens the window and helps him climb in.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Don’t worry. It all works out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clare is poised at the back of the sanctuary, hanging on father’s arm. AT THE FRONT OF THE CHURCH, Henry, in full tux but dishev and unshaven, slips in the side entrance to take his plac before the PRIEST. Gomez slinks in behind him, looking ar as if he’s a criminal. Clare notices Gomez's strange look, but she can’t really Henry. The Wedding March begins; she starts down the aisl HER P.O.V. Henry finally looks up...it is “her Henry.” Clare smiles, almost weak with love. She arrives at his s whispers.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: Henry, what the hell?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 62 63 64 The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07.13.07 5

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Don’t swear. We’re getting married. GUESTS look at one another, not sure why Henry looks so strange. Clare’s father and mother exchange curious glanc As they look over to Henry’s father, he tries to put a go face on it. He smiles weakly and gives them a thumbs up.

dialogues.speaker: PRIEST
dialogues.text: We are gathered here today...

dialogues.speaker: HENRY AND CLA
dialogues.text: They are gazing lovingly at one another. The priest’s voi drones on, but we are with Clare and Henry. INT. CHURCH MEN’S ROOM - DAY 63 The door to the men’s room flies open with a bang and gra haired Henry hurries in. He looks around expectantly as a naked arm grabs him. He spins around and sees his 30-year naked self staring back at him. They smile at one another hug.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNGER HENRY
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clare is sitting at the head table alone. The band is finishing a song. Then the BAND LEADER approaches the microphone.

dialogues.speaker: BAND LEADER
dialogues.text: And now let’s invite our lovely new couple to the dance floor. Everyone is looking at Clare, who rises...looking around. HER P.O.V. No Henry in sight, and then... She sees him, slipping back into the ballroom, the 30-yea old Henry, adjusting his tux, smoothing his newly shorn h ON CLARE, as she smiles, and walks toward him. He sees her...his first time taking in her beauty in the wedding dress. He follows her onto the dance floor and th begin to dance, everyone watching. But their conversation very private.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 64 65 66 The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07.13.07 5

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: Howdy, stranger.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Sorry I missed the ceremony.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: Well, not exactly.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Do you...do you wish I was him?

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
