dialogues.text: But you are... She smiles at him. He is the happiest man alive right now They dance off...we hear their murmured dialogue.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I wonder if I’m a bigamist.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: I think you’re allowed to marry the same person as many times as you want. Sounds of their laughter, as the music sweeps them away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear giggling, the door is pushed open, Henry carries Clare over the threshold, flicking on a light. THEIR P.O.V. A truly gorgeous room; a giant, inviting bed Henry puts Clare down on her feet. They look at each othe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON THE TWO OF THEM bouncing up and down on the bed laughing and giggling like two little kids. After a momen Clare throws herself down on the mattress with her arms w open. Henry looks down at her with a huge greedy smile on face. He looks poised to leap on her. She closes her eyes all excited and waits. He never arrives.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: Henry? She sits up.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 66 67 68 The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07.13.07 5

dialogues.speaker: CLARE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Not on our wedding night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NAKED HENRY finds himself in a thicket of bushes, he is turning, trying to figure out where he is, when he sees.. A PAIR OF MEN’S SHOES sitting on a rock near him. A neatl folded set of clothes. He realizes where he must be. He smiles. He starts to dre

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry emerges into the clearing, dressed in Clare’s fathe old clothes, a button-down shirt, argyle sweater. HIS P.O.V. CLARE, age 12, is sitting on that red blanket the meadow, a chess game laid out. She stands, waves to h

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Hello, Clare.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: Hello Henry. She is obviously so pleased to see him, though they don’t embrace.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You promised you’d play chess with me again, teach me those moves so I can kick my brother’s butt.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: ...okay. He sits down across from her on the blanket. She makes a move. They begin to play.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: Henry? Are you really a person?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Yes. What else would I be?

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: Maybe you’re an alien.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: I’m a person. Who time travels.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: They play.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: And you know me, as a grown-up?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: -.-am I married?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: I can’t tell you that.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: Why not? You never tell me anything. (they play) Do you know when you die?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Clare...

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: It’s not fair that you know everything about me but I never get to know anything about you.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: What do you want to know? She tries to be nonchalant.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: Are you married?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: .--is your wife a time traveler?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: No. Thank God. She’s a very beautiful, talented, smart, normal woman.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: Does she worry about you?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Yes, she does. -13.07 56. 68

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 68 69 The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07.13.07 5

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: Do you love her?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Very much. He makes a move. But he hears a muffled sniffling and realizes that Clare is crying.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Clare...what’s wrong?

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: It’s just that...I was hoping maybe you were married to me. He frowns, wishing he could tell her, knowing he shouldn'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clare, in the honeymoon suite, is lying in bed asleep wit the T.V. on when Henry returns. He turns it off and Clare wakes up.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: I was hoping you’d come back. Not speaking, he climbs into bed, holds her.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: I was there. With you, in the meadow. She turns toward him. Their eyes meet.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: Are we going to be able to do this?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Yes. Yes, baby. They kiss, begin to make love.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 70 71 72 73 74 75 The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07.13.07 5

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clare and Henry are moving his horrible tattered couch ou onto the sidewalk. The leaves on the trees around them ha turned brown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The camera pans across Henry’s apartment. Clare is spackl the bedroom wall. The shower is running and steam is pour out of the bathroom. She goes into the bathroom. Henry is nowhere to be seen. turns the water off, shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry and Clare are setting the table, preparing for dinn moving in between the kitchen and the front room. At one point they cross in the doorway and Henry grabs Clare. He spins her in an unexpected two step, executes a lovely tw plants a quick kiss on her forehead, and then continues i the kitchen all in one unbroken stride. Clare loves this. Clare lays out the cutlery when she hears A PILE OF DINNE PLATES shattering on the floor. She knows immediately wha has happened. IN THE KITCHEN, she sweeps up the broken plates from arou Henry’s vacated clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sits down to eat dinner alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry's face emerges from the dark. We realize, he is standing in the middle_of a snow covered street. Headligh hit him and Henry quickly moves out of the way of an_onco

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry, still naked, drifts from an alley. He glances arou shivering. Cases the buildings around him. VOICES grow louder. Henry ducks into a doorway_across the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO PUNKS pass_by the doorway, as Henry appears on the fi escape above them, checking the windows to a darkened apartment, finally breaking one. He_disappears inside as el train’s stuttering light rushes past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: es

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: + eH  76 77 78 79 80 81 82 The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07.13.07 5

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clare is showing her photographs to a GALLERY OWNER who s very enthusiastic about her work. On a shelf we see a twi with cherry blossoms stuck in a glass of water.

dialogues.speaker: CHICAGO
dialogues.text: The hi-rises come right to the edge of the beach on the l populated with sunbathers and bike riders. A very small figure, HENRY, now 32, is jogging along the boardwalk, sweating, keeping fit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The leaves are a riot of color in this idyllic neighborho Henry, in an ill-fitting mechanic’s jump suit, is running dog is chasing after him and he is hopping a fence to get away. Then we see two men running after him carrying a ho and a shovel. Henry runs into a shed and the men come in after him. Henry raises his hands to defend himself. The raise their hoe and shovel. INT. HENRY AND CLARE’S APARTMENT - NIGHT 79 Come in on a digital clock next to Clare who is asleep. W hear a strange thump and then someone moaning. Clare jump and follows the sound into the dark living room and finds Henry on all fours, bloody, shivering. He opens his eyes, sees her, tries to reach out to her. Clare flips on the l and spins around, looking for him. The room is empty. She stands there, helpless, sick with worry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beautifully decorated Christmas tree. Snow outside the windows. We PAN away from the tree and see Clare alone, unwrapping her gifts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO CARS SMASHING TOGETHER, igniting. It is Annette’s accident, replayed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Henry, 28, putting a blanket over his six year old self. AS THE CAMERA PULLS BACK FROM A FOREGROUND FENCE, w see still another HENRY, 33, making a call from an emerge phone.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 82 83 The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07.13.07 6

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: You need to page Richard DeTamble. He’s arriving on flight 207 from Pittsburg. His family was in a car accident and has been taken to St. Joseph’s hospital in Evanston. Henry hangs up the phone. As he walks away we see a third Henry, 37, watching the first Henry helping his younger s

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. CLARE AND HENRY’S APARTMENT - WINTER DAY 83 The Christmas tree bare now, brown, waiting to be tossed HENRY, 34, is looking at it. He is shirtless, in jeans. I his hands is a sweatshirt which he pulls on. CLARE comes out from the bedroom. She is fully dressed an purposeful. Seeing him, she comes to a complete stop. The stare at each other.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: Oh my God. You’re back.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Did I miss christmas?

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: You've been gone for two weeks. Are you...are you alright?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: I couldn’t get back. I got drunk, trying to trigger it. I wanted to get back to you...

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: This is really hard. You’re gone all the time.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: No more than usual.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: It feels like it though. He nods and shrugs his shoulders. This is the nature of t life. He doesn’t know what to say.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 83 The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07.13.07 6

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: There is some discomfort, some anger there, from her. As tries to figure out what to say...there is a knock at the door. They exchange a look, who could that be? She goes t open it. ANOTHER HENRY IS STANDING THERE. He is older, about thirt five. He is drenched in sweat, bleeding, and wearing a bi Northwestern sweatshirt.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Hi baby. Thank God, I couldn't remember if we’d already moved out of here yet. I need some water and something for this cut. Clare, stunned, lets him in the door. She turns. HER P.O.V. Two Henry’s are now standing in the room with

dialogues.speaker: HENRY 34
dialogues.text: What happened to you?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY 36
dialogues.text: I was chased through a plate glass window, but it’s not as bad as it looks.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: There's two of you. They both look at her.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How can this...?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY 34
dialogues.text: It happens all the time. One time when I was fifteen three of us went to a Cubs game.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY 36
dialogues.text: Do you have any hydrogen peroxide?

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: This is wrong. This defies the laws of physics. (going off to get some first aid equipment, but still talking) Matter is matter. I don’t understand how two of you can be in the same room.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 83 The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07.13.07 6

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She re-enters, shoving a wet washcloth and a tube of Neosporin at Henry 36.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY 36
dialogues.text: We don’t understand either, Clare. If we did we’d win the Nobel prize. Clare shakes her head, starts to gather her things.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY 34
dialogues.text: Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: I can’t deal with this. I have a show in two weeks. Jeremy gave me a space to work in, and I have to go. My life doesn’t just stop while you're gone, you know.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY 34
dialogues.text: Jeremy, the gallery guy? Spending a lot of time with him?

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: Oh, God, don’t even...

dialogues.speaker: HENRY 36
dialogues.text: Don’t worry, he’s not a threat.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: (spinning) How do you know? (off his shrug) And stay out of it! This is totally unfair. I can’t win an argument with two of you!

dialogues.speaker: HENRY 34
dialogues.text: Are we arguing?

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: I just...have to go to work.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY 34
dialogues.text: ...if you need a space to work, we'll get someplace else to live, with a studio for you...

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: How, how are we going to do that? You're always gone! And even if you're here...we never talk about (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 83 84 The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07.13.07 6

dialogues.speaker: CLARE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: normal things that other couples talk about!

dialogues.speaker: HENRY 34
dialogues.text: Like what?

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: Like buying a house, having kids? What is a child going to think of seeing two fathers? Why didn’t you tell me this could happen?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY 34
dialogues.text: (re: older Henry) Why didn’t he tell you? I assumed he told you back in the meadow.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY 36
dialogues.text: You should have told her. You've been screwing it up with her from the beginning.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: You know what? I’m not doing this. I can’t live like this!

dialogues.speaker: HENRY 34
dialogues.text: Clare... She leaves them alone in the apartment. After a beat:

dialogues.speaker: HENRY 34, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: She is coming back, isn’t she? He turns to Henry 36, but he is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clare is leaving the gallery space. Jeremy locks up after her. (He is the same guy who came to Henry’s and Clare’s apartment to check out her photographs.) Henry is standing across the street. She comes over to hi

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: I’m sorry about this morning.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: No, you were right. (looks at his watch) Damn, we’ll never make it home in time.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07.13.07

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: Home in time? For what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About twenty televisions are showing various programs.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: Henry, you have to get out of here, it’ll set you off.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: No. We need to watch something. He turns his back toward the screens and hands her something...an ILLINOIS LOTTERY TICKET.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: Henry... He addresses a salesman.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Excuse me, can you put one of these on the local news? The guy nods and changes all the TV’s to the local news.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: Henry, what did you do? ON THE TELEVISION, the local anchors are talking.

dialogues.speaker: LOCAL ANCHOR
dialogues.text: And now for tonight’s winning Lotto numbers...

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: You were right. We need a future. You need an art studio. We have to do something for us. The numbers begin to appear on the screen. Clare stares a the lottery ticket. She has all of them.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: Oh my God...

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: You have just won five million dollars.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 85 86 87 The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07.13.07

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Clare pulls him aside, talking in an urgent whisper.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: But you can’t do that. It’s unethical. It’s cheating.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Okay, then, rip it up. (she doesn’t) Next week they'll have one for twenty million. Clare just stands there.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Clare, there are a lot of downsides to my condition but this is not one of them. I pay a big price for what I go through, and so do you. This is the universe’s way of compensating us. I just want to buy you some happiness, some comfort, for the times I’m not around. Let me do that. Please. On CLARE’S FACE...thinking...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry and Clare are looking at a new house with a REALTOR

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: But I like it, Henry. Henry is looking out the window to the back yard.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: This isn’t it. You'll like another one better. You’re going to be very happy in it. I know.
85 86 87 Clare and the realtor explore the house. Henry walks righ a window facing the backyard and shakes his head. He retu to the others.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Nope. Not the one. The realtor eyes him oddly.  88 89 90 The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07.13.07 6

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry, Clare, and the realtor don’t even look at the hous They all walk right to the window facing the back. Henry grins. Clare grins. The realtor grins.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: We're home. See the garage out there? That’s your studio. Clare shrieks and grabs her husband. We see a timelapse s of the garden, as winter turns to spring: INT. HENRY’S AND CLARE'S NEW KITCHEN - NIGHT (SPRING) 89 Henry is cooking in the new kitchen. Clare, Gomez and Charisse are there too, working as surprisingly efficient sous chefs. As Charisse turns to grab a new cutting board see that she is pregnant. Clare is putting wine bottles o the counter and grabbing glasses from an overhead rack.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: Who wants red, who wants white?

dialogues.speaker: GOMEZ
dialogues.text: Red.

dialogues.speaker: CHARISSE
dialogues.text: None for me. (she grabs her belly) He’s awake. Come here, Clare, feel. He’s kicking. Clare feels her belly. Smiles at Charisse. Suddenly there a huge crashing sound coming from the den. Everyone turns

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry runs into the den. The others follow and freeze. He kneels to the floor holding a second Henry who is naked a bleeding. Both Henry’s look at one another piteously. The others look on, horrified. Henry’s bloody hands are press into his stomach. He can barely talk.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: This is all wrong.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: Where are you coming from? Henry begins convulsing on the floor as if being electrif His head is shaking violently. He yells.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 90 91 The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07.13.07 6

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Clare! There is a noise like a bed sheet being snapped, only muc louder, and we see him disappear from their midst. Only h bloody finger prints remain, smeared on the floor. Everyone stares at each other. Except Henry, who is very and deliberate. He picks up a box of tissues and begins t wipe up the blood from the hard wood floor. No one says a word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry and Clare are sitting on their patio overlooking a beautiful back yard. Clare is still shaken.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: You were shot, Henry. In the future you're shot.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: For all we know, it was a flesh wound, a minor thing.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: It didn’t look minor to me.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Clare, there are no guarantees. You know that. We’re all going to die.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: Goddamn it, Henry. Stop acting like nothing happened, like it doesn’t matter. You were young there. You were still young... They sit a moment in silence.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Do you know when you’re going to die?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: No, of course not. And even if I did, I wouldn’t tell you.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07.13.07

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: Why haven’t I ever seen you older? You’re never more than 40 something.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Now you’re just looking for something to be upset about.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: Maybe you stop traveling. Maybe someone finds a cure.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: What do you mean, a cure?

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: (flustered ) I don’t know. Maybe there’s a drug you can take. If it functions like epilepsy, they take drugs. We need to find someone, something. You need to stop this...

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Stop what, being who I am?

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: No. Yes. Fix it. Because I want you to be around. I want you to see our baby grow up.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Our what?

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: Our baby. She smiles at him, shyly.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Clare...what? Really? She nods. He comes to her, touches her belly.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: Please, Henry. Please go and see Dr. Kendrick.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: I don’t know who Dr. Kendrick is.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 91 92 The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07.13.07 6

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: Maybe it’s time you find out.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. DR. KENDRICK’S OFFICE - DAY 92 Henry is sitting opposite DR. DAVID KENDRICK, a hippie-is sort with a beard and a pierced ear. He’s younger than we would expect. He and Henry seem to be at a strange face o Kendrick twirling his pencil, Henry waiting for him to sp

dialogues.speaker: DR. KENDRICK
dialogues.text: .+-how did you say you found me?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: When I’m older, I travel back in time to see my wife, when she’s a little girl. And she says I mentioned a Dr. Kendrick. I found three in the Chicago area, and one was a PhD and one was a proctologist. So you’re it.

dialogues.speaker: DR. KENDRICK
dialogues.text: I’m a geneticist.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: And I have a genetic anomaly. It’s called chrono-impairment. It’s a term you came up with, apparently. That’s what Clare says, but of course, now I’ve mentioned it to you, you will call it that, and it'll be difficult to tell which came first, the chicken or the...egg. That’s the thing about time travel. It’s sort of a mobius strip. Kendrick smiles now.

dialogues.speaker: DR. KENDRICK
dialogues.text: ...did my students put you up to this? Cause you're good. Henry stands.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: I told Clare this was stupid. Maybe she remembered the name wrong.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 92 93 94 The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07.13.07 7

dialogues.speaker: DR. KENDRICK
dialogues.text: Wait a minute. Henry turns. Kendrick is writing something down.

dialogues.speaker: DR. KENDRICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This is a doctor, an excellent man, give him a call.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: What kind of doctor? A psychiatrist? Kendrick doesn’t answer. Henry takes the number and throw in the trash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clare is sitting at the same table where she and Henry fi ate. She is alone, eating Pad Thai, when her chop sticks, fall from her hand. She grabs her stomach and sits there moment, a curious expression on her face. Then her hands back to her belly, a look of concern in her eyes. Suddenly, unexpectedly, she doubles over in pain. As she so, she reaches down between her legs. A strange look on face. She raises her hands. They are covered in blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door to a dimly-lit room opens and HENRY enters. Clos the door softly behind him. Clare is lying in a hospital bed, half asleep. She hears Looks up.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: It’s gone.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: I’m so sorry. He sits at her bedside.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Do the doctors know why?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 94 95 The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07.13.07 7

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: They asked me if I was...being too active. They said that the fetus had detached from the placenta. She starts to cry. He holds her...we see on his face, he thinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Kendrick is walking to the parking lot, when HENRY approaches him. There’s something off with Henry, he’s an he’s desperate, the Henry we knew from the beginning of t story...

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Kendrick. Kendrick looks around, a little scared of Henry.

dialogues.speaker: DR. KENDRICK
dialogues.text: Mr. DeTamble, I can’t help you.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: You don’t want to help me.

dialogues.speaker: DR. KENDRICK
dialogues.text: Yes. I don’t want to help you.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: My wife had a miscarriage.

dialogues.speaker: DR. KENDRICK
dialogues.text: I’m very sorry about that but I don’t know how...

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Don’t you see? The baby is a traveler, like me, with the same genetic anomally, and it traveled out of the womb...

dialogues.speaker: DR. KENDRICK
dialogues.text: Do you realize how insane you sound?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Do you realize how insane it IS? To live like this?! How can I prove it to you? What do you want to know?! You want to know about the future?! I can tell you, cause I’ve been (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 95 96 97 The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07.13.07 7

dialogues.speaker: HENRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: there. You want to know how many children you have, you want to know what you die of? His hand is shaking...

dialogues.speaker: DR. KENDRICK
dialogues.text: Mr. DeTamble, let me take you somewhere? There’s a hospital on campus here, and I... THE CAMERA has been holding on Kendrick’s face when sudde he stops talking. His eyes freeze. All of the blood drain from his forehead, his cheeks. He cannot move. We do not have to reverse angle to know that Henry is no longer standing ten feet away from him.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. HENRY’S CHILDHOOD KITCHEN - DAY 96 It is raining outside. Henry is sitting with his eight ye old self in a kitchen. They are both eating Oreos and dun them in their milk.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNGER HENRY
dialogues.text: What’s going on?

dialogues.speaker: OLDER HENRY
dialogues.text: I was with a doctor. I want him to help us.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNGER HENRY
dialogues.text: Does he believe you?

dialogues.speaker: OLDER HENRY
dialogues.text: He’s about to, I think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry is lying on a tray ready to slide into an MRI machi Dr. Kendrick is there with some LAB ASSISTANTS. They are positioning a mirror inside the MRI machine and adjusting to reflect a T.V. monitor in the control room.

dialogues.speaker: DR. KENDRICK
dialogues.text: Okay, everybody, let’s do this. Ready Henry? For science.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: For Clare.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 97 98 99 The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07.13.07 7

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Henry is shoved into the long metal tube as everyone leav the room. The machine is turned on. A sudden knocking and banging as the magnetic resonators capture pictures of Henry’s brain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the assistants is watching the monitor, a very sta image of Henry lying motionless inside the tube. Suddenly Henry disappears. The assistant jumps up panicked and confused and stares into the MRI room. The MRI chamber is empty.

dialogues.speaker: ASSISTANT
dialogues.text: Dr. Kendrick! Dr. Kendrick! He’s gone. He’s just gone. Dr. Kendrick doesn’t even look up from a notebook he is jotting on.

dialogues.speaker: DR. KENDRICK
dialogues.text: Wonderful. The assistant looks at him like one of them is out of the mind. INT. KENDRICK’S OFFICE - DAY (FALL) 99 Autumn outside. Henry and Clare are sitting with Kendrick is showing them a sheaf full of test results.

dialogues.speaker: KENDRICK
dialogues.text: Alright. The results are back. Clare and Henry look at each other and smile, nervous abo what they will hear.

dialogues.speaker: KENDRICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Based on the tests we ran, we can affirm, as you suspected, that your brain emits a blast of electro- magnetic energy akin to an epileptic’s just at the moment that you...travel. You can see it here. He shows them the images.

dialogues.speaker: KENDRICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But that’s not going to help you now, with another baby on the way.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 99 100 The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07.13.07 7

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Clare and her belly. 99 Henry glance at each other. Clare puts her hand on

dialogues.speaker: KENDRICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: These types of drugs are much too strong for a fetus...

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: We're eight weeks in. It seems to be going pretty well. Maybe the last miscarriage was just a fluke.

dialogues.speaker: KENDRICK
dialogues.text: We're going to find out. We’re going to look at Henry’s genes. A disease that is as...disruptive as Henry’s often appears as a kind of stutter. A bit of code, repeated too many times that says, in essence Bad News. Huntington's Disease, for instance, is just a bunch of extra CAG triplets on Chromosome 4.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: But how do you know which...?

dialogues.speaker: KENDRICK
dialogues.text: Educated guessing. Like any scientific endeavor. We’re going to look at what we call the clock genes. They govern circadian rhythms, keep you in sync with the sun, and they exist in many different types of cells all over the body... As Kendrick goes on, Clare and Henry take hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry and Clare are sound asleep. Henry stirs. Something' wrong. He pulls his hand up to his face. It is bright red jumps up, turns on the light, and sees Clare still asleep a pool of her own blood. For a moment he just sits there. Then gently, he tries to wake her.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Clare. Honey...

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 100 101 102 The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07.13.07 7

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: (smiling) I was dreaming.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Clare, wake up. You're bleeding. Her eyes flash open, consciousness returns. Then the full weight of what is happening slams into her. She grabs for husband and pulls herself up.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: It’s gone?! Henry grabs hold of her and holds her as tightly as he ca

dialogues.speaker: CLARE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (crying now) I was dreaming of the baby and us...in the meadow.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. CHARISSE’S AND GOMEZ’S APARTMENT - DAY (WINTER) 101 Clare and Henry arrive at the door. A hastily scrawled si says DO NOT RING THE DOORBELL. They knock. Gomez appears.

dialogues.speaker: GOMEZ
dialogues.text: Hey, hey you guys! It’s been too long, come on in. The baby’s napping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is littered with toys everywhere. Like a colorful torn blew through. A little boy, a TODDLER, is sitting playing with a big plastic hammer...

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: Hi Max. Charisse enters. Greets Clare.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You look great. Ever the pragmatist, Charisse doesn’t let the elephant in room go unnoticed.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07.13.07

dialogues.speaker: CHARISSE
dialogues.text: Are you sure you guys are up for this? I mean, you could come over another time, we wouldn’t be offended.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: We're fine. Aren’t we Henry? He tries to nod, sure, but the truth is, neither of them fine.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: The new baby’s six weeks old and we've never even met her. Suddenly we hear a baby crying. There is an awkward pause Everyone looks uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: CHARISSE
dialogues.text: Okay, I’1l bring her out. Gomez and the childless couple wait for a moment. Gomez f once is completely at a loss.

dialogues.speaker: GOMEZ
dialogues.text: Kid's a big cryer. Charisse emerges with a crying, fat baby girl.

dialogues.speaker: CHARISSE
dialogues.text: C’mon, Rosa, come on, baby... Clare comes over to look at him.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: Hi there, Hi Rosa... Charisse hands the baby over to Clare, who holds him.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ohhhh, she’s so beautiful. Clare lights up as she takes her in her arms. She is a natural. Her face glows.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hold her, Henry. He shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 102 103 104 The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07.13.07 7

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Excuse me. I just gotta get some... He leaves the room. Charisse motions for Gomez to go with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gomez finds Henry staring out at the street. It is snowin

dialogues.speaker: GOMEZ
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Don’t mind me. Gomez puts his hand on Henry’s shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: GOMEZ
dialogues.text: Clare still upset about the miscarriage?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Miscarriages. Plural.

dialogues.speaker: GOMEZ
dialogues.text: You know there’s...other ways to go.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Clare wants to keep trying.

dialogues.speaker: GOMEZ
dialogues.text: And you don’t.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: I think it’s killing us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clare and Henry walk home in silence. They pass a LITTLE (ALBA), sitting on a stoop, watching them. Clare smiles a her as they pass. Henry notices this. After a moment, he decides to dive right in.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: I think we should adopt.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 104 105 The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07.13.07 7

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Why Clare? Why is it so all important that it be our baby?

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: That’s not what it’s about.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Then what is it?

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: Henry...I want some part of you, a part of us, that will stay with me, that I can actually hold on to...

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Clare...

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: What is wrong with my wanting one normal thing in my life? One normal everyday occurrence, to be a mother, to bear a child, the child of the man I love. Why can’t I have that?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: I’ve traveled to the future, many times, and I’ve never seen us with a baby, never...

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: I don’t want to hear this. She starts to walk ahead of him.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: We can’t go through another loss! She covers her ears and continues walking. We hold on Henry's face. INT. DR. OSMAN’S OFFICE - DAY 105 Henry is lying on a special contraption in a urologist’s office. He looks far away. DR. OSMAN hovers over him for moment.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 105 106 107 The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07.13.07 7

dialogues.speaker: DR. OSMAN
dialogues.text: Okay, Henry. Just to be official about this, I need to ask you one last time, if you’re sure...

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: I signed the papers.

dialogues.speaker: DR. OSMAN
dialogues.text: Yes, I know. But ...a vasectomy is rarely a one-party decision.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Well this time...it is. End of discussion. INT. DR. OSMAN'’S OFFICE - WAITING ROOM - DAY 106 Henry walks through the waiting room with some difficulty

dialogues.speaker: NURSE
dialogues.text: Are you all right? Would you like us to call someone, a cab? Henry waves her off and heads into the corridor. He’s mad about ten steps and we can tell he looks woozy. He hurrie toward the men’s room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The trees are bare and it is cold. Henry stands, wrapping old sweater around him, as Clare, now 18, runs down into meadow toward him.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: Henry! (she sneezes, wiping her nose on her sleeve) I have a cold.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Sorry about that. He winces a bit, in pain from the operation. Shifts his weight.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 107 The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07.13.07 8

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: I just...don’t feel like being here right now.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: Is it me? Did I do something...?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Do something? God, the universe is perverse sometimes. I did something for you. It was hard and you won’t like it, that’s all I can say.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: What was it?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: I can’t tell you. I wasn’t even going to tell you in the present.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: Then why did you do it?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: To stop us from fighting.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: We're fighting? Why?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: That’s none of your business.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: Just once. One time, will you tell me the answer to something I am asking you?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: You're a kid... Without apparent premeditation, Clare slaps Henry, hard. steps back.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hit me again. She is confused and shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: What is wrong with you!

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 107 108 The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07.13.07 8

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Do it. I want you to hurt me. Clare, really angry, grabs Henry’s hand and bites it hard In retaliation, he reaches out and kisses her, very rough She pulls back.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: That’s wasn’t very nice.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: I’m sorry. Clare... She starts to cry.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: You never kissed me before. Now Henry really hates himself.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Oh Clare. Just forget that. Just erase it. Come here. Please. She tentatively steps forward. He kisses her again. It is moment this young girl has been waiting a long time for. Clearly, this time he does it right.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. CLARE’S STUDIO - DAY 108 Clare is in her studio, making paper. She is spreading ou the slab of pulp with her hands, smoothing it, shaping it with a trowel. Henry comes in. Sits. Sneezes.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: You sick?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: I was with you. In the meadow. You had a cold.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: (smiles) That was the first time we kissed. A long beat. We feel for the first time the long history between them, all the things they don’t have to say.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07.13.07

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: I did something. I did something I felt I had to do. Clare looks down.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: Don’t tell me...

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: Don’t tell me something that’s going to make me hate you.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: I had a vasectomy. She doesn’t respond.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If you want a baby I will be happy to adopt one, or we can get a sperm donor, but I am not creating another child with my...genetic makeup, who will die.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: (barely audible) How dare you?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: How dare you?! After everything I’ve given you?! Everybody warned me...

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Clare...

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: You tricked me! You tricked me into loving you! You came to the meadow and inserted yourself into the heart and mind of a young girl. You think I wanted this life? A husband who disappears without any warning?! Who would want that? Only me, a little child who loved you. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 108 109 The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07.13.07 8

dialogues.speaker: CLARE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Who believed in you! I never had a choice!

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: (stunned) If what you want so desperately is to have a baby, your own baby, you do have a choice. You can do it if I step out of the way.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: Get out. Get out of here! Her eyes starts to well up. Henry turns and walks away. Clare is alone for a moment. After a time she KICKS OVER paper bin. Goop spills out over the floor, then, she HEAR

dialogues.speaker: SOMETHING
dialogues.text: A car starting. She runs outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry is in the car, pulling out of the driveway.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: Henry, you can’t drive. What are you doing? WHAT ARE YOU DOING?!!! Clare rushes out into the street. She is running after He who is driving down the street, wildly. HER P.O.V. It is clear he has not driven before. He misse stop sign and a car shoots out in front of him. He brakes fast to avoid it and swerves up onto a curb. He slams on brakes and puts the car in park. CLARE runs, arriving at window, breathless, afraid to fin the car empty. Neighbors are coming out of their houses. she approaches she is grateful to find him inside. He loo devastated. She opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Move over.  110 111 112 The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07.13.07 8

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry slides to the passenger seat as Clare takes command the car and backs it into the street. Neighbors watch curiously as she drives back toward their house. Clare pulls into their driveway and parks.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: What the hell were you doing? You could have killed someone. You could have killed yourself. Henry doesn’t answer. Clare stares at him. Suddenly it da on her that that may be exactly what he was doing.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh God, Henry. I didn’t mean it. I didn’t mean what I said before. He holds her. Shushing her, petting her hair. She cries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is the middle of the night and Henry and Clare are sou asleep. Suddenly, a slightly younger Henry appears nude i the moonlight looking down at the bed. He is shivering. C glances up and sees him. Confused she looks over and sees older Henry laying asleep beside her.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: Henry, what are you doing...?

dialogues.speaker: YOUNGER HENRY
dialogues.text: (whispering) Shhh. I’m freezing, just for a minute... He peels down the sheets and climbs on top of her. Clare groans. His fingers lightly cover her mouth. He moves in and repl them with his lips. Looking once more at the handsome you above her, she closes her eyes and accepts the moment. Th younger Henry, his eyes aglow, enters her and presses clo The older Henry barely stirs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry comes in with groceries. After a moment, Clare join him. They silently unload the groceries, doing that famil domestic dance, moving around each other to put things aw

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07.13.07

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Henry stops and watches her.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: What’s up with you?

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: You're weird. You’ve been weird for weeks.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: (long beat) I’m pregnant, Henry. Henry stops with the groceries.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: One night, I woke up, and...you were in bed with me, but it wasn’t you, I mean it was, but you were younger, by about five years. They look at each other. Not embracing or hugging, just knowing what they are in for.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Are you happy?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: .-.if we lose it again...

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: From this moment on, we are not fighting. We are not getting excited. If stress is what causes the traveling, we are going to make sure that this baby has the most serene gestation on the planet. Henry nods in assent, but we see the conflict in his eyes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry and Clare are looking at an ultrasound of their bab a monitor above the exam table where DR. OMA MONTAGUE is watching the screen.

dialogues.speaker: DR. MONTAGUE
dialogues.text: Eighteen weeks and perfectly healthy. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 113 114 115 116 The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07.13.07 8

dialogues.speaker: DR. MONTAGUE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (smiling) Oh, I can see the sex. It’s a girl.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: A girl?! Clare is excited, but she tries to mellow it down. Keep serene. They look at the image, the little heart beating the monitor. ON HENRY, his face still registers a modicum of doubt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clare is very pregnant now, lying on the bed, looking at book of baby names.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: What about Mia? That’s a pretty name. Or Caroline?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry is shaving. He doesn’t like this.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Where did you get that book?

dialogues.speaker: CLARE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Charisse gave it to me.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: I’m not sure I’m ready to...pick a name. He rinses his face. Sees his hands are shaking. He starts to...FALL BACKWARD...the razor clatters to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (sounds very distant) I just want some ideas...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry completes his fall in a dinosaur diorama in the Fie Museum. He is hiding behind a woolly mammoth that is bein stalked by a group of plaster NEANDERTHALS. A group of sc children are looking at the display and he freezes. He lo strangely appropriate to the setting. As soon as the chil move on he searches for a door in the diorama and finds i just as a new group of students arrives.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 117 The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07.13.07 8

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry is in a janitor’s outfit exiting a door saying “Maintenance”. He sees another group of children looking diorama with their teacher. They are all about 10 years o And then, to his amazement, one of the girls turns and lo directly at him. She has an amazed look in her eyes. Sudd she calls out.

dialogues.speaker: ALBA
dialogues.text: Daddy? Henry freezes.

dialogues.speaker: ALBA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Daddy! She breaks from the group and runs over to him, hugging h with all her might. Everyone is staring at them. The TEAC hurries over.

dialogues.speaker: TEACHER
dialogues.text: Alba, who is this?

dialogues.speaker: ALBA
dialogues.text: He’s my daddy.

dialogues.speaker: TEACHER
dialogues.text: (disbelieving) Alba, your father’s dead. Henry is speechless. Alba is looking at him. He finds his voice.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: I’m her uncle. It’s alright. Alba turns to the teacher, picking right up on his ruse. She’s very good at it.

dialogues.speaker: ALBA
dialogues.text: He’s my uncle, but I call him Daddy sometimes.

dialogues.speaker: TEACHER
dialogues.text: (doubtful ) Alba, you need to stay with the group. (beat) If your uncle would like to join us...

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 117 118 The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07.13.07 8

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Alba takes Henry’s hand. They follow the group, but lag behind...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And as a DOCENT talks to the kids, Alba whispers to Henry

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Alba. This is the first time I’ve ever met you.

dialogues.speaker: ALBA
dialogues.text: (smiling) How do you do?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: How old are you?

dialogues.speaker: ALBA
dialogues.text: Ten.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: How old were you...when I died?

dialogues.speaker: ALBA
dialogues.text: Five.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: (crushed) ...five?

dialogues.speaker: ALBA
dialogues.text: I’m sorry. I shouldn’t have told you.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: It’s okay. It’s okay. (beat) I’ve never traveled past my own life.

dialogues.speaker: ALBA
dialogues.text: You told me it started after you saw me for the very first time, when I was still in Mommy's belly.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: How is your mother?

dialogues.speaker: ALBA
dialogues.text: She’s okay. Sad.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 118 The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07.13.07 8

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: (keeping it together) And what about you? Tell me about you. How is school? What are you learning?

dialogues.speaker: ALBA
dialogues.text: Not much at school. But I read all the time. I’m reading about Egypt and Mom and I are reading “Lord of the Rings” and Gramps is teaching me the violin.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: (in disbelief) You mean...my dad?

dialogues.speaker: ALBA
dialogues.text: Uh huh. He says I’m really good. It runs in the family. And I heard Grandma sing. It was beautiful. At the opera, in Chicago. Aida. Henry is stunned. She nods.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: You went...? You time traveled there?

dialogues.speaker: ALBA 9
dialogues.text: Mom says you and I are exactly alike. Except Dr. Kendrick says I am a prodigy because mostly I can go exactly where I like.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: You can control it? When you leave and when you come back?

dialogues.speaker: ALBA
dialogues.text: I saw you and Mommy walking on the street. You walked right by me. I smiled.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: You did?

dialogues.speaker: ALBA
dialogues.text: You were arguing.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07.13.07

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: I’1l bet. (beat) Oh God, Alba, I am so happy to meet you. So happy.

dialogues.speaker: ALBA
dialogues.text: Me too Daddy. Me too. They hug. ON THE TEACHER who looks back to Alba... HER P.O.V. Alba is now standing alone.

dialogues.speaker: TEACHER
dialogues.text: Alba, where’s your uncle?

dialogues.speaker: ALBA
dialogues.text: He had to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clare is still in the bed, looking at the baby book, when Henry comes in from the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: That was a long shave.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Clare. I met Alba.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: Alba...?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Our daughter. We named her Alba.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: You met her?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: In the future. She was 10. She was so smart...so beautiful. You’re going to love her so much.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: Oh my God. We have a daughter, Henry. Alba. They smile at each other, like kids.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07.13.07

dialogues.speaker: CLARE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It’s all going to be alright. This reminds Henry of Alba’s comment. That he would be de by the time she is five. But he is not going to spoil thi moment. It’s just a brief shadow, passing across his face

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Yes. It’s all going to be fine.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 120 EXT. CLARE AND HENRY’S HOUSE - NIGHT (WINTER) 120 Henry, carrying an overnight bag, is escorting Clare to a waiting car, where GOMEZ is driving. 121 INT. GOMEZ’S CAR - NIGHT 121 Clare and Henry pile in. Gomez, groggy, turns around.

dialogues.speaker: GOMEZ
dialogues.text: Don’t even think of drenching my car in amniotic fluid.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Just drive!

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: (gripping Henry) Don’t leave me.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: I won't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A NURSE is pushing Clare in a wheelchair to a birthing ro Henry is hurrying just behind them.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: Henry!!!

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Right here.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: Stay where I can see you!!! He scurries to her side and takes her hand.  123 124 125 126 127 The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07.13.07 9

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clare is in the hospital delivery room surrounded by her DOCTOR, NURSES, and Henry. She is panting. She whispers t him.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: Henry...look... Henry looks back over his shoulder... HIS P.O.V. of FOUR OTHER HENRYS, all older than the prese Henry, dressed in doctor’s coats and wearing surgical mas Henry smiles, as Clare screams out, she is PUSHING...

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: Okay push. She’s coming. She’s almost here. Clare pushes and yells. Alba comes crying into the world.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. BABY’S ROOM - DAY (SPRING) 124 We hear a VIOLIN PLAYING, as the CAMERA PANS off the wind to reveal RICHARD serenading his granddaughter who is lyi in a bassinet. Gomez and Charisse are there, and Clare's parents, as we pan out of the room to... INT. CLARE’S BEDROOM - DAY (SUMMER) 125 Alba is a toddler now, taking her first steps. Clare and Henry are on the floor, clapping and encouragin her to come. The camera PANS onward, passing into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The same piece is being played by two violins, as we come across Richard, sitting in a chair, playing, and the move of the camera reveals...ALBA, now four, playing a small violin, meeting her Grandpa’s eyes. She makes a mistake a laughs. The camera PANS ON TO...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Clare is taking a BIRTHDAY CAKE out of a bakery box She sets a candle in the shape of a FIVE on the center of cake...the camera pans beyond the number five to...

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 127 128 The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07.13.07 9

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: HENRY, looking at it. Knowing what it signifies to him. H takes a deep breath. Smiles at Clare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry and Clare are hanging streamers and setting up for Alba's birthday party. Clare steps down from a small ladd catching a glimpse out the window. HER P.O.V. Alba, five, is playing with another little gir About ten. They are making a snowman.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: Henry, are the guests already arriving?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: Who is that, playing with Alba? Henry looks over.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: That’s Alba.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: Yes, but who’s with her?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Clare, it’s your daughter. They’re both your daughter. She’s time traveling. Clare gasps. Takes Henry’s hand. They watch the girls fro distance. After a moment, both Albas look up and see thei parents. They wave. Clare and Henry look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Is it too weird?

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: No. I think it’s kind of...magical. They kiss. The sound of the door opening causes them to t Little Alba is coming in. She seems a little disturbed, quiet.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 128 129 The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07.13.07 9

dialogues.speaker: CLARE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Where’s Alba?

dialogues.speaker: ALBA
dialogues.text: She’s gone.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: You want to talk about it?

dialogues.speaker: ALBA
dialogues.text: No. Little Alba walks by them and into her room. Henry and Cl exchange glances.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Family and friends are gathered around, among them Charis and Gomez and their children. Alba listens as they all si Happy Birthday to her. She blows out the candle. ON CLARE, smiling, clapping, her smile turning to a sligh frown as she sees... HER P.O.V. Alba is still upset. On the verge of tears. Sh goes over to Henry and hugs him tightly. He gets on his knees. Whispers something in Alba’s ear. It seems to chee her. She runs off to play with her friends. Clare comes over to Henry.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: What was that?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: (rising) What was what?

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: Why is she upset?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: She’s fine. She just felt sad for a minute. She’s a very unusual girl. Clare gives him a look.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: What does she know, Henry?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 129 130 The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Clare. Don’t create something out of nothing, she’s fine. Clare glares at him.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: Tell me or I’1l imagine the worse.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Go ahead then. Imagine. You’re going to do it anyway. -13.07 95. 129 He goes off, leaving Clare there, pensive, watching her daughter. INT. ALBA’S BEDROOM - NIGHT 130 Clare is dressing Alba in her jammies, combing out her ha from a bath.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: Did you have a nice birthday?

dialogues.speaker: ALBA
dialogues.text: Yes, mommy.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: I saw you hug Daddy. I thought maybe you were crying. Alba gets silent.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Honey, if something’s bothering you, you can always tell Mommy.

dialogues.speaker: ALBA
dialogues.text: No I can’t.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: ALBA
dialogues.text: Because Daddy told me not to. Clare sits back on her heels a little.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: And you love Daddy. Alba is starting to get teary again. She nods.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07.13.07

dialogues.speaker: CLARE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Well, I love Daddy too. (beat) But sometimes...he can be wrong. And keep secrets that he shouldn’t keep. Alba is looking at her.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Do you want to tell Mommy what it is? Alba nods.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It’s alright if you do. I won’t tell Daddy that you told me.

dialogues.speaker: ALBA
dialogues.text: You promise?

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: I promise.

dialogues.speaker: ALBA
dialogues.text: Daddy’s going to die. Clare goes white.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: How do you know this?

dialogues.speaker: ALBA
dialogues.text: Alba told me.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: Uh-huh.

dialogues.speaker: ALBA
dialogues.text: She told me that Daddy would die when I was five years old. This hits Clare hard, but she masks it. Clare suddenly hu her daughter hard to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry is sitting at a desk, working at his computer. Clar enters. Sits down on a chair, facing him.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07.13.07

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: How does it happen, Henry?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: How does what happen?

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: Alba told me. You die when she’s five years old.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Clare...we don’t know for sure...

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: Don’t do that. You have to tell me what you know.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: I don’t know any more than you know. It hasn’t happened yet.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: The day you fell into our den, you were shot.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: That could be anything... Tears come into Clare’s eyes.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: But that’s it, isn’t it? You get shot?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Honestly, I don’t know. I wish I could help you...

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: You can. You can do something. Do something to change it.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: I’m not like Alba, I can’t control it like her. I can’t will myself back in time...

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: Maybe she can teach you.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: She’s five years old!

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07.13.07

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: Please, Henry!

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Alright, what if, what if I find myself in this place where I’m going to be shot and I...I change it. What will happen? What if I get shot...somewhere in the past? And I change that? It might undo everything. I might never meet you. Alba might never be born. They are staring at each other.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Cause listen to me. I would not change one single moment of the life I’ve led. Not even my mother’s death. Because I’ve come to realize, despite all the pain and the loss and the...times of unhappiness...I love my life. I love you. I love my daughter. And given the chance, I would change... nothing. Clare hears this. It sinks in. She takes his hands.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: Just promise me. Promise, that when you get there, and you realize this is the moment...that you will try to stop it. Try to save yourself. Will you do that?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Yes. I promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON THE BEDSIDE CLOCK, PAN OVER to see Henry and Clare are sleeping. The phone rings. Both of them look at one anoth

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Hello? (he listens, alarmed) Okay. Stay there. We’1ll leave right now.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: Who was that?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 132 133 134 135 136 The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07.13.07 9

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: It was me. I’m down in the Monroe Street Parking Garage, no clothes, fifteen degrees below zero. God, I hope the car starts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s winter. Clare’s car is driving furiously through deserted Chicago streets. It is frigid and there is snow everywhere. Alba is tucked into her car seat, fascinated their adventure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car is pulling into the Monroe Street Garage. It is nearly empty. They see a pay phone near the ticket booth. phone is hanging off the hook. Clare takes a ticket and begins driving in circles, searching for Henry.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: I don’t see him. Henry gets out of the car...

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Keep driving, I’1l meet you at the next level.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car arrives. The skyline of Chicago is lit up, Henry framed against it as he comes back to the car.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: It’s empty. There’s no one around.

dialogues.speaker: ALBA
dialogues.text: Maybe you went back.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: I hope so. EXT. - GARDEN/HENRY AND CLARE’S HOUSE - EVENING (SPRING) Alba and Clare are working in the garden. Wild spring flo dot the grass.

dialogues.speaker: ALBA
dialogues.text: Where’s Daddy?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 136 137 138 139 The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07.13.07 1

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: He disappeared this morning.

dialogues.speaker: ALBA
dialogues.text: Do you think he went to the meadow?

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: Don’t think about it, honey. He’1l be back soon, I’m sure. They hear a SCREAM from inside. INT. HENRY’S AND CLARE'S HOUSE 137 Clare runs inside and finds Henry lying in the hallway, shivering, his body white and cold. He can barely speak.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Help...me. Clare takes one look at him and runs for the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry is lying in a hospital emergency room covered in blankets that are flapping with his shivering. A RESIDENT examining him. It is clear that he is confused.

dialogues.speaker: RESIDENT
dialogues.text: I’ve never seen anything like this. How on earth did you get hypothermia in April? Henry is chattering too powerfully to speak.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: Will he be all right?

dialogues.speaker: RESIDENT
dialogues.text: We need to warm him up, raise his core temperature. Then we’ll see. They bring in a bucket of warm water. The resident motion for Clare to leave the room. The camera tracks with her i the hallway. From inside the room, she hears Henry scream

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clare is sitting with Gomez and Charisse. Dr. Kendrick co in and joins them at the table.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 139 140 The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07.13.07

dialogues.speaker: DR. KENDRICK
dialogues.text: I just spoke with the attending physician. It’s going to be okay, Clare. He saved the foot.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: Oh, thank God. Thank God. He puts his arm around her.

dialogues.speaker: DR. KENDRICK
dialogues.text: But he won’t be able to use it for a while. He’1l be in a wheelchair for a few months.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: No way. That’s no good. He has to be able to walk, to run. If he can’t run...that’s how he survives. Clare and Gomez share a look. Then Clare looks away. INT. HENRY’S AND CLARE’S BEDROOM —- DAY (SUMMER) 101. 139 140 Henry lies in bed curled up. The door opens and Alba come in, holding her teddy bear. She walks past a wheelchair o to her father who smiles weakly as he sees her. She climb into bed with him. He reaches out to stroke her hair.

dialogues.speaker: ALBA
dialogues.text: Daddy?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Hmm?

dialogues.speaker: ALBA
dialogues.text: Are you dying?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: ALBA
dialogues.text: Are you going to have to be in this chair from now on?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: I’m not sure. He pulls her close.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07.13.07

dialogues.speaker: HENRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Things are happening fast now, sweetheart. I’m traveling a lot, it might be the drugs they’re giving me for the pain. I don’t understand everything I see.

dialogues.speaker: ALBA
dialogues.text: That happens to me too. He hugs her tight.

dialogues.speaker: ALBA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Try to stay, Daddy.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: How do you do it?

dialogues.speaker: ALBA
dialogues.text: When I feel like I’m going. I sing. I sing to myself.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Let’s sing then...

dialogues.speaker: ALBA AND HENRY
dialogues.text: “The wheels on the bus go round and round, round and round, round and round, the wheels on the bus go round and round...” But Henry’s voice cuts out. Alba sits up. His pajamas are empty in the bed covers. 141 EXT. HENRY AND CLARE’S HOUSE - NIGHT (WINTER) 141 Henry has materialized in the bushes. He can hear people the neighborhood banging pots and shouting, “Happy New Ye Some firecrackers go off. A burst of RED FIREWORKS explod in the distant sky. HIS P.O.V. He sees Clare sitting alone on the porch. She looks sad. Then, someone calls her, with urgency...”Clare She runs in. Henry pulls himself up with the help of some hedges, unab to move his legs. He looks through the window: HIS P.O.V. He sees himself lying naked on the living room floor. His stomach is blown open. Blood is everywhere. Cl kneels at his side. People in New Year’s Eve party hats a gathering around him, looking down in shock.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 141 142 143 144 145 The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07.13.07 1

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Henry’s hands presses against the window, and then...HIS IS GONE, leaving only the imprint there. INT. HENRY AND CLARE’S BEDROOM - DAY 142 Alba is staring at the camera.

dialogues.speaker: ALBA
dialogues.text: Where’d you go? Reverse angle to Henry. He has just returned. He is subdu by the vision of his own death.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: It was New Year’s Eve. I guess it was about...five months from now. We were...we were having a party.

dialogues.speaker: ALBA
dialogues.text: Goodie. I like parties. EXT. HENRY AND CLARE’S HOUSE (FALL) 143 The leaves are changing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry is wheeling himself in his chair over to Alba, who kneeling at a DOOR and working on how to pick a lock.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: No, you need to feel it. It will tell you when to twist. She works at it some more and then suddenly we hear the tumblers move. The door unlocks.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That’s my girl.

dialogues.speaker: THE KITCHEN
dialogues.text: Henry holds up an onion and looks at his wife.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Okay. This...is an onion.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: Yes. I’ve read about them.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 145 146 147 148 The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07.13.07 1

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Henry wheels himself to the counter and pulls out a knife

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Very good. Onion adds flavor to almost every dish, soup broths, rice. Now, to peel an onion, you take a very sharp knife, lay the aforementioned onion sideways on a cutting board and remove each end, like so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry talks Clare through the preparation of a chicken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clare and Alba and Henry are roasting a chicken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clare brings out a finished meal to her husband and daugh She puts it in front of them and serves some to each plat Cautiously, Henry takes his first bite. Clare looks at hi expectantly. He smiles.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: This is good. This is really good. It's terrific, Clare.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: It was nothing. It only took thirteen years.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: But it was worth waiting for. She kisses him. Suddenly Alba jumps from the table and lo out the window. She exclaims excitedly.

dialogues.speaker: ALBA
dialogues.text: Look everyone, it’s snowing!

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: Maybe we’ll have a white Christmas after all. It’s been a long time. ON HENRY, pensive -- the end of the year bringing the vis of his death at New Year’s closer.  149 150 151 The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07.13.07 1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clare and Alba are decorating the top of a lovely Christm tree. Henry, in his wheelchair is working on the bottom.

dialogues.speaker: ALBA
dialogues.text: Can we open the presents tonight?

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: What presents? Santa doesn’t come until after you’re asleep.

dialogues.speaker: ALBA
dialogues.text: I already looked in the closet.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: What closet? Alba, it was locked. She grins.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Christmas is in the morning. That's the rule. No presents on Christmas Eve.

dialogues.speaker: ALBA
dialogues.text: Well, what are we going to do then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The whole family is gathered around the fireplace listeni to Henry’s mother sing. The song “Es ist ein Ros Entsprungen.” We recognize it as the song she was singing Henry when they were driving in the car, that Christmas, long ago. Henry watches his family work on the tree, listens to the music. A BOY’S CHOIR is now joining in with his mother, singing another verse of the song. Henry wipes tears from his eyes, even as he smiles. INT. HENRY’S AND CLARE’S HOUSE - NIGHT 151 The boy’s choir continues on the soundtrack, as we observ PARTY, IN FULL SWING, but SILENT, only the choir singing. It is New Year’s Eve. The house is full of guests all wea New Year’s Eve party hats. Dr. Kendrick is there, Chariss

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 151 152 The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07.13.07 1

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: and Gomez, Richard, others. Alba is running around tootin horn and making lots of noise. ON HENRY, as he wheels into the living room. He pauses. HIS P.O.V. He sees the room laid out before him. It remin of something...the image he had of himself, dying; the on thing missing is his own body, lying bleeding on the floo He wheels over to the bar, where Gomez is getting a drink

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Hey, Gomez. Let’s go outside.

dialogues.speaker: GOMEZ
dialogues.text: It’s cold out there.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: You're getting soft in your old age. Just for a minute. Gomez shrugs and wheels him outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is cold.

dialogues.speaker: GOMEZ
dialogues.text: What’s up, boss?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Just...thanks for everything. You’ve been the best.

dialogues.speaker: GOMEZ
dialogues.text: What the hell are you saying?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Something...might happen tonight. And I wanted to tell you...I know I’ve been a pain in the ass every now and then but it’s been great. It’s been really great. Gomez looks at him, unable to speak.

dialogues.speaker: GOMEZ
dialogues.text: Henry... Suddenly Clare appears at the door with a blanket.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 152 The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07.13.07 1

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: Are you guys crazy? Henry, put this on.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Gomez, can you give us a second? Gomez, tears welling in his eyes, leans over and kisses Henry. He leaves.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: What was that about?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Clare...it’s time.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: This is the night. I saw it. I traveled here, a few months ago.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: Henry, no.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Here, sit in my lap. She sits, covering them both with a blanket.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: Why didn’t you tell me? Why did you let me invite all these people?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: I didn’t want you to be alone.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: Henry. You're going to stop it. Right? You’re going to...do whatever you can do...

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: I will. Clare looks in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: I’m scared. He kisses her. They hear people shouting. Henry looks up.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 152 153 The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07.13.07 1

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: HIS P.O.V. A red burst of fireworks goes off in the sky.

dialogues.speaker: PEOPLE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: It’s time. It’s time. Come on everybody. Ten, nine, eight... where are Henry and Clare...? ON HENRY...his hand is shaking...and we are... EXT. CLARE’S MEADOW - MORNING 153 Henry, naked and disoriented, is in the meadow. It is col and there is snow on the ground. He does not have the use his legs. He is looking for the clothes Clare usually lea for him, instead he sees... HIS P.O.V. A DEER, staring at him. It is majestic and beautiful. He HEARS Clare’s father and brother, approaching...

dialogues.speaker: MARK
dialogues.text: It was over here. And then, he sees something else, his eyes go wide... CLARE, at six years old, is walking toward the deer. She not see Henry. She’s holding some of her father’s clothes folded up. She smiles, reaching out to the deer.

dialogues.speaker: MARK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I can’t see it...

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIP
dialogues.text: Wait for a sound. Henry sees the deer starting to move... HIS P.O.V. He can see the bulky silhouette of Phillip, through the grass, sees him raise his rifle...

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: No, no, Clare... Henry moves in the grass, trying to reach her... Phillip TURNS SUDDENLY, seeing Henry’s movement and FIRES RIFLE. Henry’s body is blown out of the frame. THE CAMERA HOLDS the gently swaying grasses still moving behind him.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 153 154 155 156 The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07.13.07 1

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The deer RUNS OFF. Clare, alarmed, runs toward the meadow dropping the clothes. From overhead we see Mark and Phillip at the edge of the meadow, looking in through the grass, trying to find thei kill. There is nothing there but a mass of blood on the w trampled snow. Clare arrives through the trees. Phillip i shocked to see her. He grabs her up, holding her. INT. HENRY AND CLARE’S DEN - NIGHT 154 We have seen this scene before, earlier in the film, but time it is from the wounded Henry’s point of view, as he on the floor, looking up at them, mortally wounded. Henry Clare, Charisse and Gomez are hovering over him. He can barely talk.

dialogues.speaker: OLDER HENRY
