dialogues.text: This is all wrong.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: Where are you coming from? He disappears. EXT. HENRY’S AND CLARE'S HOUSE - NIGHT 155 Clare sitting on the porch. She hears...A LOUD SCREAM. Sh gets up, runs into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry’s naked wounded body is on the FLOOR. People are aghast. His stomach is blown open. Blood is everywhere. People in New Year’s Eve party hats are gathering around looking down in shock. Fireworks are exploding in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Clare. Clare kneels down beside her husband. He can barely speak

dialogues.speaker: HENRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I tried...

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: Henry, don’t talk. Dr. Kendrick pulls that red blanket off the couch and com rushing over to cover Henry’s wound.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 156 157 158 The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07.13.07

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: I love you...

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: Henry... He looks up and sees his daughter staring at him.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Alba, my sweetheart...Alba. She crouches beside her dad, stroking his forehead. Henry looks back at Alba and Clare. Outside we hear firecrackers and the sounds of horns blaring and people cheering. His eyes follow the sounds to... 110. 156 HIS P.O.V. The window...the frosted handprint of the othe Henry evaporating there.

dialogues.speaker: GOMEZ, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I think we better call the police.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 157 The shades are drawn and Clare is in her room. Alba comes and lies beside her mother.

dialogues.speaker: ALBA
dialogues.text: It’s okay, Mommy. He’1ll be back someday. Clare hugs her daughter.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: I miss him, Alba. I miss him so much. EXT. CLARE’S MEADOW - DAY 158 Alba, about 8 years old, is playing with two friends in t meadow. They are hitting a whiffle ball with a bat, runni around, playing baseball. THE BALL rolls into bushes. Alba runs to get it, and...then...she stops... HENRY stands at the other end of the meadow.

dialogues.speaker: ALBA
dialogues.text: Daddy?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 158 The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07.13.07 1

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Henry, 40, hears the name and his head swivels in her direction. Their eyes meet. For a moment they don’t move. And then Alba, her face exploding in a huge smile, runs toward him.

dialogues.speaker: ALBA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Daddy!! I knew I’d see you again. I knew it.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Alba. When is this? How old are you?

dialogues.speaker: ALBA
dialogues.text: I’m eight.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Your mother still leaves clothes here.

dialogues.speaker: ALBA
dialogues.text: She says you never know. Alba is looking at him.

dialogues.speaker: ALBA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh Daddy. You’re so handsome. (the other kids come over) You remember Max and Rosa don’t you? Gomez's kids?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Yeah. You’re so grown up. They are staring at Henry like he is a ghost.

dialogues.speaker: ALBA
dialogues.text: Run back to the house, you guys. Tell my mom he’s here. Tell her to come. Henry and Alba sit on the log. Where he and Clare had sat many times before.

dialogues.speaker: ALBA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Tell me the story. Of how you and Mama met.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Doesn’t she tell you?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07.13.07

dialogues.speaker: ALBA
dialogues.text: She does, but not as good as you do.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Well, it was right here. In this meadow. And one fine day your mother, who is only a tiny thing whose hair is bigger than she is, goes out to the clearing and there is a man there -

dialogues.speaker: ALBA
dialogues.text: With no clothes.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: With not a stitch on him. And after your mother gives him a blanket she happens to be carrying, he explains to her that he is a time traveler, and for some reason I’1l never understand, she believes him.

dialogues.speaker: ALBA
dialogues.text: Because it’s true. They HEAR Clare calling, breathless, at a distance...

dialogues.speaker: CLARE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Henry?! Henry?! Henry rises.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: (feeling strange) I think I’m going...

dialogues.speaker: ALBA
dialogues.text: No, Daddy, sing...

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: I can’t sing... He begins to murmur, not really singing...

dialogues.speaker: HENRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: “The Wheels on the bus go round and round...”  159 160 161 The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07.13.07 1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clare, now in her mid thirties, is pushing through the tr trying to get there...

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: Henry!

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: “,..the wheels on the bus go round and round, all through the town...” WIDE SHOT as Clare arrives in the meadow. HER P.O.V. Henry, at a distance, turns to look at her. Th eyes meet...and then...he disappears.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: Henry...wait... Clare hangs her head. She breathes hard. Alba comes to he She puts her arm around her mother’s waist. Clare stands. She holds her stomach, with one hand, the other, wipes aw tear. She wanted to see him, to touch him...so much. She shakes her head, looks up, as the shot WIDENS OUT to incl the whole meadow. The picture seems to shift, transform to black and white. INT. CLARE’S STUDIO - LATE AFTERNOON 161 A LARGE art piece is laid out on the floor; a huge photog of the meadow printed on canvas. It has elements of paint and drawing. An older woman’s hand is working on the canv reaching across it, as we pan up the arm to reveal... CLARE HERSELF, sitting on the floor, working. She is clea older, in her eighties. Her hair is gray but her manner i youthful. She is humming, happily. And then, suddenly she stops working. Her ears perk up, listening. She turns tow the door...she hears a sound...a door opening? She looks Stands. CLARE'S P.O.V. At the end of the long hallway, the door i ajar...and there is a figure, in the shadows, or is there

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 161 The Time Traveler's Wife - White Prod. Draft - 07.13.07 1

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 161 ON CLARE'S FACE...as we hear footsteps, yes, definitely, footsteps. And on her face, a smile of utter contentment blooms, as tears start to fill her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: CLARE
dialogues.text: Hello Henry. Hold on her face.
